Candida Rosa will use her third loan to buy the following products: rice, beans, oil, sugar, coffee, corn, candies, sodas, household cleaning products, personal hygiene products, etc.  This investment will enable her to cover all of her basic expenses, increase her product inventory (and thereby her profits), and also meet her loan repayments.

loans.use: to buy products for her grocery store

loans.name: Flavia Valentina

texts.es:
La señora Flavia Valentina es casada, tiene 50 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 5 hijos 2 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la talabartería la elaboración de sandalias para damas, inició este negocio junto con su esposo y hasta el momento lleva 30 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al mismo trabajo.

Solicita un préstamo para ampliar su producción de sandalias, ya que quiere tener un negocio capitalizado y con mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Flavia Valentina is married, is 50 years old and she did not have the opportunity to study. She has 5 children, 2 of whom are studying. She is dedicated to the craft of leatherwork to make sandals for women. She began this business together with her husband and up to now she has 30 years of experience. She counts on the support of her husband who is dedicated to the same work.

She seeks a loan to increase the production of her sandals because she wants to have a business that is capitalized and makes larger profits.

loans.use: to buy materials to make sandals

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en: Beverly is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. She has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2008.  In the future, Beverly hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, cereals and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is earning an income through her small plot of land where she plants a variety of vegetables. She patiently sows the land and plants in order to produce vegetables to sell in the market. The earned income is usually used for household expenses and she has not been able to save for her children’s education. She feels difficulty in providing the needs of her seven children, but still thankful because they are helping her with their source of income.  

Now, Violeta is requesting a loan of P10,000 to use to maximize her business. It will be used to buy a variety of seeds and vegetables such as eggplant and squash to sell. She hopes that through the loan she will now be able to save for the educational purposes of her children.

loans.use: to buy a variety of seeds and vegetables.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 41-year-old married woman. For the past nine years she has reared chickens and sold mineral licks for cows in Kiambu. Rose's monthly income is 20,000 KES. 

Rose is requesting her second loan from KADET LTD to increase her stock of mineral licks and buy chickens to raise. She plans to use her profit to expand her business and open a shop.  In the future, Rose wants to be build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise and sell

loans.name: Jamilette Del Rosario

texts.es: Jamilette Del Rosario  tiene 27 años de edad, su actividad  a la que se dedica es a la venta de mercadería en general en el cual ya tiene años de experiencia en el negocio, sus clientes la visitan por la calidad de ropa que ofrece. Esta emprendedora tiene dos hijos que todavía se encuentra a su cargo y su sueño es  que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y que su negocio  crezca cada día. Jamilette Del Rosario está solicitando financiamiento para comprar productos como camisas, blúmer, sandalias, pantalones, faldas entre otros productos que demandan sus clientes.
texts.en: Jamilette Del Rosario is 27 years old. The activity to which she dedicates herself is the sale of merchandise in general. She now has years of experience with this business.  Her clients visit her because of the quality of the clothing that she offers. This entrepreneur has two children that can still be found in her care and her dream is that her children will complete their studies and that her business will grow each day. Jamilette Del Rosario is seeking financing to buy products like shirts, underwear, sandals, pants and skirts among other products that her clients require.

loans.use: to buy shirts. underwear, sandals, pants and skirts among other products that her clients require.

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a 59-year-old widow with 4 children. She has owned and operated a retail store at home for the past 5 years. She earns about 3,500 PHP monthly from business operations.

She became a GDMPC member in 2006, and is now requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase daily use merchandise to sell in order to earn more income. She hopes to sustain the store's revolving funds to prolong business operations. Magdalina is planning to renovate her house so she may have a better place to live in.

loans.use: to purchase daily use merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a married woman who has five children. She is 46 years old and resides at Molicay, Ozamis City, Philippines. Anita owns and operates a farm, planting & harvesting rice to sell to earn a living, and she's been 8 years in this business. Each month, she earns about 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 5,244 PHP to purchase fertilizer. In 2007, Anita joined GDMPC. She hopes to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en: Danilo, 50-years-old, is married. His main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice to sell. He has eighteen years of experience. With his last crop, he earned about PHP 35,000. Now, he is asking for a loan of 38,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings and pay the labor cost for planting his farm. Future loans from KIVA would be very useful to him, as he sees the loans as the only chance for the growth of his business and financial security.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings and pay the labor cost for planting his farm.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 41 years old and is married with three children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past five years, she has run a sari-sari (variety) store where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, and beverages. Juliet has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.

Juliet is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, beverages, and snacks

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar is 59 years old and married. He works full-time as a rice farmer. When the harvest comes, Oscar's hard work means that he can sell good-quality products to increase his net profit. His income is about 29,000 PHP each season (every five months). Oscar has over 31 years of experience in this field. His wife manages their hog-raising business and earns additional income to help meet their daily needs. 

Oscar is requesting a 38,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and insecticide for his rice field. He hopes to help improve his family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and insecticide for his rice field

loans.name: Raquil

texts.en:
Raquil is 31 years old and lives in Capucao, Ozamiz City, Philippines. She is married with three children. Raquil's business has been growing as she has wished and now she is requesting a loan from GDMPC. 

Raquil will use her loan to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She hopes her business will continue to progress.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Marivic has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 12 years. 

She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, shampoo and soap. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Marivic hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of canned goods, shampoo and soap to sell.

loans.name: Rhaida

texts.en: Rhaida is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Rhaida has a shop that sells RTW's like jackets and raincoats. She has had this business for 12 years. She requested a loan of 17,000 PHP to buy additional stocks of shirts, slippers and raincoats to sell as well as  jackets and t-shirts. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rhaida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of different kinds of clothing to sell, like jackets and t-shirts.

loans.name: Elpidio

texts.en:
Elpidio is 56 years old and is married to Estelita. They are both farmers in the village of La Paz. Elpidio and his wife are very thankful because they have been blessed with three children. Elipidio is a responsible father. He has been engaged in his business for twenty-five years. He earned about PHP 30,000 with his last crop. 

Right now, Elpidio is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 38,000 to buy rice seedlings, fertilizers and insecticides for his farm business. He is hoping that he will have a plentiful harvest to support the education of the children.

loans.use: to buy rice seedlings, fertilizers and insecticides for his farm business.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie, age 22, is selling firewood as a source of income. She patiently does such activity because she was not able to look for a better job. For now, to increase her income, she is asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy wood to sell at a higher price.

Julie is wishing for a comfortable life with her family soon, so sacrifice and patience are her weapons to grow and achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 35 years old and is married with one child. She lives in the Philippines. For the past five years, she has run a shop where she sells a variety of eggs. Margie has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.

Margie is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy additional socks of eggs to sell. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy eggs to sell

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine a 33-year-old married woman who lives in Tinacla-an, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For the past four years, she has earned a living selling fuel. Catherine usually earns about 5,000 PHP each month. She joined GDMPC in 2011.

Catherine is requesting a 10,384 PHP to purchase more fuel to sell. She hopes to improve her business one day.

loans.use: to buy fuel to sell

loans.name: Phillomen

texts.en: Phillomen is 36 years old, from Njabini, and is married with two children. She is a farmer and has been for many years. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy fertilizers, dairy meal and seedlings for her farm. She was introduced to KADET by a KADET staff member. She hopes to be the leading farmer in her area.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, dairy meal and seedlings for her farm.

loans.name: Narita

texts.en:
Narita is 48 years old and has two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Narita's husband is a laborer. For the past four years, Narita has been a banana planter and she earns 1,000 PHP each month. She been a member of the Kiva partner GDMPC since 2011.

Narita is requesting a 2,674 PHP loan to purchase farm chemicals. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Solaika

texts.en:
Solaika is 44 years old and is married with seven children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past four years, Solaika has run a shop where she sells ready-to-wear clothing, personal care products, and accessories. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.

Solaika is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan to buy additional stocks of wallets, perfumes, baby oil, and shavers to sell. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, personal care products, and accessories to sell

loans.name: Hipólita

texts.es: Hipólita es socia del Bancomunal Suni, es madre de 3 hijos, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace más 10 años, se dedica  a la venta de golosinas, queso y carne en las ferias. Ella aprendió a ahorrar, cuenta que antes tenía muy poco capital, ahora su negocio está creciendo porque todo lo que ella aprende en las capacitaciones de su Bancomunal lo pone en práctica y lo mejor es que le ayudan con la educación de sus hijos, ahora el préstamo que está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de carne y queso que venderá en las ferias.
texts.en:
Hipolita is a member of the Suni communal bank. She has three children and has been a member of Finca Perú for more than 10 years. She sells snacks, cheese, and meat in the market. 

Hipolita learned how to save because before she had very little capital. Now, her business is growing because she applies in practice everything that she learns in the communal bank trainings. The best part is that they help her with her childrens' education. 

Hipolita will use this loan to purchase meat and cheese that she will sell in the market.

loans.use: to purchase meat and cheese to sell at the market.

loans.name: Japherson

texts.en: Japherson is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD to purchase assorted foodstuff and serving dishes for his food production business. Japherson will use the profit from his loan to expand his business and start a poultry business. His dream is to have a happy family.

loans.use: to expand his food production business and purchase chicken

loans.name: Osias

texts.en:
Osias is 57 years old and married with four children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. For the past five years, Osias has been operating a general store where he sells a variety of products to local community member to earn a living. Each month Osias earns 5,000 PHP. He joined GDMPC in 2008.

Osias is requesting a 9,800 PHP loan to purchase new items to expand his product offering. In the future, he hopes to improve the general living condition of his family.

loans.use: to purchase items to expand his product offerings

loans.name: Abelino De Los Angeles

texts.es: Albino De Los Ángeles tiene 61 años de edad, el negocio que tiene el emprendedor es la venta de pollo tiene ya años de experiencia en el negocio lo cual la calidad de producto y el servicio que le ofrece a sus clientes le ha permitido aumentar sus clientela. Este emprendedor es una persona luchadora que toda la vida ha trabajado  para ofrecerle a sus hijos una calidad de vida mejor. Albino De Los Ángeles está solicitando financiamiento para comprar variedad de pollo y poder ofrecerles a sus clientes.
texts.en: Albino De Los Ángeles is 61 years old.  This entrepreneur’s business consists of selling chicken and he has many years’ experience.  The quality of the product he offers has allowed him to increase his number of customers.  This entrepreneur is a hard worker who has worked hard to provide a good quality of life for his children.  Albino De Los Ángeles is asking for a loan to buy a variety of poultry to offer to his customers.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Kertha Bakti Group

texts.en:
Ni Luh and all the members of Kertha Bakti group decided to continue to borrow from MUK. Because they need to increase the population of the pigs, they need a bigger loan size. They will still need loans until they can support their businesses by themselves.

Ni Luh gets full support from her husband. He helps Ni Luh to maintain the pigs. With this loan she will purchase two superior piglets and use the rest for feed. The profit will be used as capital for her business.

Ni Luh wishes she had access to a vet who would always be ready when needed.

loans.use: To purchase two superior piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Paquito

texts.en: Paquito is from Kinangay Norte, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 61 years old. Paquito is married and has three children. Paquito owns and operates a general store. Paquito been in his business for five years and earns 20,000 a month from it. In 2008, Paquito joined GDMPC. Paquito is requesting a loan of 32,700 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee

loans.name: I Ketut

texts.en:
Having succeeded in the previous loan, I Ketut got a new loan from MUK. 

His profit from breeding cows has helped to support the education of his children and he is very grateful for that. 

Today he got loan of 8,000,000 IDR. He will use this to buy a female cow for 4,000,000 IDR and one male calf for 2,000,000 IDR. The remainder of the loan will be used to purchase fertilizer for his fields. 

I Ketut currently has three female cows and one male calf. He hopes to sell lots of calves to make the most profit. He still has two children who he hopes to put through college so that they can have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy one female cow, one male calf and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mertha Sedana Group

texts.en:
For housewives in Bali, it has become commonplace to have pigs that are raised to improve the family's income. But the problem is most of them do not know the correct way of raising pigs. To enhance their capabilities, they joined in a group to exchange information as well as to apply for loans.

Ni Ketut, 35, a housewife, became the head of the group Mertha Sedana. The group hopes to enhance their capabilities in terms of raising pigs and get the capital to support their businesses. Ni Ketut will use her part of the proposed loan to buy three piglets and food. In five months, the pigs will be ready for sale. The profits from this venture will be fully used to support the family economy.

loans.use: To buy three piglets and food.

loans.name: Putri Sari Group

texts.en:
Ni Made successfully maintained her pigs and her husband supported her business because the result improved the family's income. She also successfully renovated the barn. 

Now she needs a new loan to purchase piglets and she also has a plan to buy a saw. Because the loan is not enough to purchase all of this, her husband will also give her money to support the business. 

She hopes the loan will give her healthy piglets that she can later sell.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and a saw.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary used her previous loan to add more stock of spare parts. She is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loans successfully. 

Mary will use the loan to purchase more stock of spare parts for her shop. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to expand the business and see it grow.

loans.use: To add stock of spare parts to her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.
 
To earn a living, Maria has a business selling snacks such as banana cake, cassava cake, hot cake, "biko and benignit" (a stew or soup) and different kinds of juices. She earns about PHP 3,000 per month doing this type of work. 

Maria has a requested loan to buy raw ingredients such as flour, sugar, margarine, cheese,and powdered juice.
 
Maria has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making juices and native delicacies.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is a father of one child, age one.

He has been in farming for two years in his rural home in Western Kenya. His farm produces vegetables and sugarcane for the local market. He works as a motorcycle driver as well for additional income to that of farming.

Kennedy has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says he wants to focus on improving and diversifying  his farming business. He is also keen on buying his own motorcycle to ease as well make cheaper the delivery of milk and other farm produce to the market.

He concurs with other farmers in the area that animal diseases and drought are the main challenges.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is from Segatic Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 73 years old. Rita is married and has seven children. 

Rita used her last loan to purchase fertilizer and expand her business. Her business is successful, and she's taking a new loan to buy feeding supplies for her swine business. 

In the future she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies for her swine.

loans.name: Bebelonie

texts.en:
Bebelonie is married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 40 years old and her two children are in school.

Bebelonie has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She requested a loan amount of PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving business.

Bebelonie has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is requesting her fourth loan from NWTF for 14,000 PHP, which she will use to buy products for her general store.  The income from her store helps to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Walimata

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Walimata est une jeune célibataire de 24 ans qui habite dans une des localités du Sénégal. Elle évolue depuis plus de 10 as dans le secteur du commerce. Elle vend du poisson  et des beignets le soir. Elle a choisi cette activité de commerce par  recommandation de sa maman. Et tout ce qui l’intéresse  c’est la recherche de profits. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis décembre 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour renforcer son fond de roulement. Son objectif est de développer son activité de vente de poissons en achetant une quantité plus importante de poissons et d’autres produits rentrant dans la préparation des beignets qu’elle vend le soir. L’augmentation de ses bénéfices lui  permet de mieux prendre en charge ses besoins personnels et de soutenir ses parents.
texts.en: Ms. Walimata is a young, 24-year old single woman who lives in Senegal. For the last 10 years, she has worked as a seller. She sells fish, and in the evenings she sells pastries. She chose this activity as it was recommended by her mother. What motivates her above all is making a profit. She has been a member of one of the U-IMCEC branches since December 2011. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to increase her working capital. Her goal is to develop her fish-selling business by buying more fish and other ingredients used in preparing pastries, which she sells in the evenings. Increased profit will help her better meet her own needs and to support her parents.

loans.use: to buy fish and food items for her business.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 36 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in the Philippines. Merlinda has a sari-sari store (general store) where she sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has run this business for three years. 

Merlinda is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.  Merlinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Merlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente, membre du groupe de crédit  Alpha, Femme  dynamique, entrepreneur, âgée de 30 ans. Elle est  vendeuse de braises, farine de manioc. Son mari est un évangéliste intercesseur dans une Eglise de réveil. Il ya 6 mois qu’elle  fut informée de micro crédit qu’octroi l’IMF Hekima. Ainsi, elle bénéficia son premier crédit de 50$ pour démarrer ses affaires. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et d’appui à la scolarité de ses  enfants. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  2eme  crédit. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses affaires prospèrent positivement. Ainsi elle a  décidé d’augmenter son montant de crédit pour ce nouveau cycle. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  3 sacs de braises et 1 sac de farine de manioc.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir et acheter une parcelle dans le futur. La cliente remercie Hekima pour  les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en: The customer, who is a member of the Alpha loan group, is a dynamic woman and entrepreneur who is 30 years old. She sells live embers and cassava flour. Her husband is an evangelical mediator in a revivalist church. Six months ago she was informed about the micro-loans that IMF-Hekima grants and thus she was given her first loan of US$50 in order to begin her business. The profits she makes from her activity are used for her savings, to buy food and to help out with her children's schooling. Meanwhile, she has been granted a second loan. During this period, the customer has seen her business prosper and so she has decided to increase her loan for this new cycle. This new loan will enable her to get fresh supplies: three sacks of live embers and one sack of cassava flour. For the future she would like to see her children grow up buy a piece of land. The customer thanks Hekia for its actions to help poor women with low income become autonomous.

loans.use: to pay for three sacks of live embers and a sack of cassava flour

loans.name: Geyling De La Concepcion

texts.es:
Geyling es una joven originaria de León, de 29 años de edad, de oficio comerciante en el negocio de pulpería, soltera, madre de un hijo el cual esta  a su cargo. Su actividad la inicio desde hace 1 año vendiendo útiles de librería poco a poco empezó a vender agua, gaseosa  y chivería hasta comprar mas cosas para buscar mas ingresos, recibe el apoyo de su mama en sus tiempo libres, no cuenta con otros ingresos   pues vive solo de las ganancias que obtiene de la pulpería, comercializa sus productos en la misma comunidad para satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes, sus expectativas son llegar a tener un negocio mas amplio y crecer económicamente. 

Realiza el crédito para invertir en su negocio en la compra de granos básicos como galletas, gaseosa, enlatados, jugos, avena, arroz, pan,  entre otros productos que son básicos para satisfacer al cliente ya que este le ayudara porque surtiendo mas el negocio con productos le generara mas venta de las que obtendrá mas ganancias, sus planes futuros es ampliar mas el negocio en infraestructura como en clientela.
texts.en:
Geyling is a young woman from León who manages a grocery business. She is 29 years old, single, and has a child under her care. Geyling started her business one year ago selling office supplies, but gradually she began selling water, sodas, and yogurt. She eventually bought more products in order to earn more income. Geyling receives helps from her mother whenever she has free time. She has no other income, so she relies solely on the profit that she earns from her grocery store. Selling products in her community enables her to meet the needs of her customers. Her expectations include having a larger business and financial growth.

The loan she received will be invested in her business by purchasing basic goods such as cookies, sodas, canned goods, juices, oatmeal, rice, bread, and other products that will keep her customers satisfied. This will be a great help because having a well-stocked business will generate more sales, and eventually more income. Her plans for the future include expanding the infrastructure of her business and growing her customer base.

loans.use: to buy cookies, sodas, canned goods, juices, oatmeal, rice, and bread.

loans.name: Sari Kencana Group

texts.en:
From the last loan, Jro Nyoman managed to get a profit of 1,000,000 IDR. The gain is very helpful to the family's finances as they are currently experiencing difficult times due to increasingly expensive necessities of life. 

Jro Nyoman, with the Sari Kencana group, decided to continue borrowing from the MUK due to its special help in developing their pigs businesses. She will use this loan to buy two superior piglets for fattening as well as pig feed. To reduce the cost for feed, she also gives the pigs a traditional feed made from various kinds of leaf, such as banana leaf. She hope this business can support her children's education.

loans.use: To buy 2 superior piglets for fattening and pig feeds

loans.name: Sergia

texts.en:
Sergia is a married woman who has four children. Sergia is 44 years old, and resides at Hoyohoy, Tangub City, Philippines. 

Sergia raises crops such as root crops for sale to earn a living and she's been 14 years in this business. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this business. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. In 2006, Sergia joined GDMPC. In the future, Sergia wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Rosa Maruja

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Progreso Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rosa, tiene 62 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen siete hijos, seis de ellos ya mayores de edad y uno de 13 años, tres de ellos aun viven en su casa y el menor estudian en colegio. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
 
Ella es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de productos naturales, ella trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al dia ya que solo visita a sus clientes que siempre le encargan sus productos,  deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Lo que más vende son productos para el hígado, vitaminas y adelgazantes. Tiene tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.	

Este crédito es para comprar productos naturales para la venta. Lleva dos años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. 

Su sueño es tener una farmacia.

En la foto está la Señora Rosa con su nieta.
texts.en:
The Progreso del Mar Communal Bank meets every 15 days in beautiful San Mateo beach resort in the city of Manta. Manta is known for its beautiful beaches, visited during all seasons of the year by both national and foreign tourists. Here the majority of the people are engaged in fishing and tasks related to the sea.

Sra. Rosa lives here.  She is 62 years old, married and has seven children, six already adults and one 13-year-old. Three still live at home and the youngest child attends school. Her husband is a fisherman.

Rosa is a housewife who, in order to have her own income and help her husband with household expenses, sells natural products. She works two or three hours a day, three days a week. She visits clients who buy from her on credit and collects from them every eight days. Her best selling products are for the liver, vitamins and weight loss. She has had this job for three years and it is going well.

This loan is to buy natural products to sell. She has been a member of the Communal Bank for two years and she enjoys it because the payments are easy to handle.

Her dream is to own a pharmacy.

Sra. Rosa is shown in the photo with her granddaughter.

loans.use: to buy natural products.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en: Bernardita, who works hard to support her family, is married and has been operating a charcoal retail business in the Philippines for two years. She is now requesting a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more charcoal to sell to customers. Bernardita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell to customers.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida, a 47-year-old married mother of four, has been earning a living by raising pigs in the Philippines for 27 years. Additional income is derived from buying and selling meat.

Leonida is requesting a loan of PHP 60000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs as she works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Cinthia Rumina

texts.es:
Cinthia es una joven mujer casada, que junto a su esposo se apoyan mutuamente con el fin de progresar y salir adelante constantemente. Su esposo se dedica a laborar como albañil mientras que ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes. Actualmente esta pequeña familia vive en la ciudad de Ica, Perú, la cual ha sufrido constantes terremotos y lluvias, lo que los ha llevado a enfrentar este tipo de retos, ya que muchos de estos los afectaron de distintas maneras.

Cinthia tenía muchas ganas de superarse y desarrollarse como microempresa, es por eso que decidió tener una pequeña bodega en el frontis de su casa, lo que le ha permito generar los ingresos diarios que necesita y laborar todo el día. Ella cree que su negocio está empezando a crecer debido a que siempre ha tratado de tener su bodega lo mejor surtida posible. Cinthia nos comenta que fue gracias a un familiar, el mismo que tiene una bodega también, que aprendió sobre cómo manejar la bodeguita.

Gracias al apoyo que se le está brindando, Cinthia podrá terminar poner el falso piso a su pequeña bodega, lo que le permitirá que sus productos ya no tengan ningún tipo de contacto con la tierra, es así también como los clientes se sentirán más seguros y felices de comprar en su tienda, lo que le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos y de esa manera techar la bodega de material noble y así poco a poco llegar a cumplir su gran sueño, terminar de construir su casa por completo.
texts.en:
Cinthia is a married young woman. She and her husband help one another so that they can make constant progress and move forward. Her husband works as a bricklayer while she sells groceries. Their small family currently lives in the city of Ica, Peru, which experiences constant earthquakes and heavy rains. Many of those who have had to face these challenges have been affected in different ways.

Cinthia has plenty of drive to succeed and grow in her micro-enterprise. This is why she decided to set up a small grocery store in front of her house, which generates the daily income she needs and provides her with something to do all day. Cinthia believes her business is starting to grow, so she tries to keep her shop well-stocked as much as she can. She says that thanks to a relative who also has a grocery store, she learned how to manage her business.

With the assistance being provided, Cinthia will be able to finish installing a raised floor in her small shop. This will enable her products to avoid contact with the ground, which will make her customers feel more secure and happy when shopping in her store. As a result, her income will increase, thus allowing her to install a roof on her shop made of solid material. In addition, Cinthia will gradually be able to fulfill her great dream of finishing the construction of her house.

loans.use: to finish the installation of a raised floor in her shop.

loans.name: Karen Patricia

texts.es: Karen Patricia tiene 27 años de edad, su actividad económica a la que se dedica es a la venta de cosméticos este negocio lo aprendió de su mama que es comerciante que vende cosméticos y que le enseño, la idea del negocio surge también de apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar y, ella tiene un hijo que esta pequeño y que depende de ella todavía. Karen está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de productos como lápiz, base, polvo, perfumes, cremas y también variedad de ropa que sus clientes le solicitan.
texts.en:
Karen Patricia is 27 years old. She has a cosmetic business that she learned from her mother who is a cosmetics saleswoman and taught her. Her desire to help her husband with household expenses also motivated her to start her own business.

Karen Patricia has a young son who is still dependent on her. She is applying for funding to buy products such as lipstick, base, powder, perfume, creams and also a variety of clothing requested by her customers.

loans.use: to buy lipstick, base, powder, perfume, creams as well as a variety of clothing requested by her customers.

loans.name: Mikpamahou Group

texts.fr: MIKPAMAHOU est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe du nom de Ablawa cécile (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 45 ans. Ablawa cécile est mariée à un certain Parfait. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Ablawa cécile vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec lui, les charges de la maison. Ablawa cécile a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Ablawa cécile vend de la bouillie faite à base du maïs avec du pâté et de façon secondaire, Ablawa cécile vend deS tissus du riz et de l’huile végétale depuis cinq ans dans une région du Benin. Ablawa cécile s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse et de se faire plus de profit, Ablawa cécile sollicite, ensemble avec les autres  membres du groupe MIKPAMAHOU, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Mikpamahou is a group of three people living in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group named Ablawa Cécile (whose hand is raised in the photo) is 45 years old.

Ablawa Cecilia is married to Parfait. The couple has five children, all attend school and are their dependents. Ablawa Cécile lives with her children and husband and ensures together with him the household expenses.

Ablawa Cécile left school at primary level. To meet her various responsibilities, Ablawa Cécile sells porridge made ​​from maize along with paté, and secondarily sells fabrics, rice and vegetable oil. She has been doing this for five years in one of Benin's regions. Ablawa Cécile resupplies in one of Benin's markets.

In order to better meet the demands of an increasing number of customers and also to increase their revenue, Ablawa Cécile, together with other Mikpamahou group members, is requesting a first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: Buy fabrics, rice and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Mondoukpè

texts.fr: Mondoukpè est âgée de 36 ans et vit au Bénin. Mondoukpè n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Mondoukpè a cinq enfants à sa charge dont quatre représentent ses propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Mondoukpè vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la maison. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, Mondoukpè a appris la fabrication des bijoux qu’elle vend et de façon secondaire Mondoukpè vend des boissons et des produits divers depuis dix huit ans dans sa région au Benin. Mondoukpè s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. Grâce au revenu que lui génèrent ses activités, Mondoukpè contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Mondoukpè  sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois prêts reçus précédemment par Mondoukpè ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Mondoukpè is 36 years old and lives in Benin. She never went to school. She has five dependent children, four of them her own children. All the children attend school. Mondoukpè lives with her children and her husband, and the couple handle together the various household responsibilities. 

To help support her family, Mondoukpè learned to make jewelry, which she then sells. She also sells beverages and various other products. She has been practicing this activity in her district of Benin for 18 years. She buys her stock in a market of Benin. The income earned through her activities has allowed her to help with the household expenses. 

To meet the needs of a growing customer base, Mondoukpè is seeking a fourth loan from ALIDé. All three previous loans were repaid without incident

loans.use: to buy beverages and other items for resale.

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en:
Fedelina, a 56-year-old widowed mother of five, earns PHP 3,000 a month, enough for living expenses, by cultivating bananas. In operation for the past 10 years, her farm is located in Hoyohoy, Tangub City where the family lives.

In 2007, Fedelina joined GDMPC and is now requesting a loan of PHP 5,500 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to cultivate. She hopes to expand her enterprise in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to cultivate.

loans.name: Rosario Rocio

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Progreso Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rosario, tiene 25 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 7, 4 y 1 año, el mayor de ellos  estudian en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca. 

Ella para sentirse útil y ganar algo por su cuenta se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos de Avon y Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los días más que todo en las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedido,  deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, le encanta vender y esto lo viene realizando desde hace tres años en los que le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene bastante clientela. Lo que más vende son los cosméticos y los perfumes. 

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres años y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. 

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Progreso del Mar Communal Bank meets every 15 days in beautiful San Mateo beach resort in the city of Manta. Manta is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited during all seasons of the year by both national and international tourists. Here the majority of the people are engaged in fishing and tasks related to the sea.

Rosario lives here. She is 25 years old, married and has three children, 7, 4 and 1 years old. The oldest is in school. Her husband is a fisherman.

In order to feel useful and to earn something on her own, Rosario sells Avon and Yanbal beauty products by catalog, such as cosmetics, perfume and women’s accessories. She works every day, most often in the mornings since it is easier for her to make her calls at that time. She goes door to door and by request, selling on credit and collecting payments weekly. She loves selling and has been doing so for three years. The business has gone very well since she has many customers. Her best selling items are cosmetics and perfume.

She will use this loan to buy perfume, costume jewelry, cosmetics and creams. She has been a member of the communal bank for three years and she enjoys it because of the help provided through loans.

Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to purchase perfume, costume jewelry, cosmetics and creams.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: Alfred is a 49-year-old married man with 3 children. He has been a civil servant for 8 years. His personal goal is to buy a motorcycle and his business goal is increasing the number of motorcycles. He wants to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Yaguaron Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Yaguaron Poty se encuentra integrado por 15 integrantes, quienes están en el 3er. Ciclo con una buena calificación, ellas son muy trabajadoras y tienen la esperanza de poder ayudar a sus familias a tener un mejor estilo de vida y que sus hijos no tengan que pasar por necesidades como las que ellas tuvieron que pasar.
La Sra. Juliana quien es la presidenta, ella las ha guiado en este trayecto para que ninguna se desanime durante su lucha.  Ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles de todo tipo, como empanadas, sándwich, croquetas y demás. Tiene una clientela formada ya que la comida que hace siempre es bien vendida y apreciada por sus clientes.  Su deseo es poder seguir trabajando y a la vez motivar para seguir a sus amigas.
Juliana solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, condimentos, verduras, y demás insumos que necesite para seguir haciendo los alimentos que vende.
texts.en:
The group called "Yaguaron Poty" consists of 15 members who are starting their third loan cycle with a good rating. They are hard workers who have hopes of helping their families achieve a better lifestyle and seeing that their children receive the necessities that they were not able to have.

Sra. Juliana is the president. As she leads her group on their journey, she advises them not to get discouraged when they encounter struggles. Juliana sells all types of food such as empanadas, sandwiches, croquettes, and other items. She has an established customer base who appreciates her food, so she always has good sales. Her wish is to continue working so that she can motivate her friends to do the same. Juliana is requesting a loan to buy meat, condiments, vegetables, and other supplies that she needs so that she can continue preparing the food that she sells.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, vegetables, and other supplies.

loans.name: Hadijah

texts.en: Hadijah is a 30-year-old, single mother of four children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the hotel business for 4 years. She started with 200,000 shillings and now has 4,000,000 shillings as working capital. Her hardships are seasonal weather, inadequate capital to purchase stock and high taxes. Her personal goal is educating children and building a permanent home. Her business goal is to expand business into new markets. Hadijah wants money to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Eugenia Antonia

texts.es: La señora Eugenia es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su familia , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida , ya que uno de sus proyectos para este 2012 es iniciar un cuarto para sus hijos , su esposo labora en una empresa privada para apoyarle con los gatos del hogar , doña Eugenia desde hace varios años labora para un empresa , pero su sueldo no le ajusta para poder invertir de una sola en todos los materiales de construcción , con el préstamo anterior logro comprar piedras y arena , ahora necesita compra hierro , cemento , piedrín , entre oros materiales para iniciar la construcción , pero no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios para la inversión . El préstamo lo quiere para la compra de materiales de construcción Agradece la confianza que le brinda para mejorar su calidad de vida y cumplir sus metas.
texts.en: Eugenia is a resident of Ticuantepe municipality.  Together with her family, her future plan is to improve their living conditions.  One of the projects for 2012 is to begin to construct a room for her children.  Her husband works for a private business to support the household expenses.  For several years, Eugenia has worked for a business, but her salary isn't sufficient to invest in all the construction materials at one time.  With the previous loan, she was able to buy gravel and sand.  Now she needs to purchase iron, cement, blocks, and other materials to begin construction, but she doesn't have the economic resources necessary for the investment.  She would like the loan to purchase the construction materials.  She is grateful for the trust and confidence offered to her so that she can improve her quality of life and complete her goals.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is patiently selling vegetables through a door-to-door offering of her products. She saw an opportunity of generating income in this business and she is very happy for not being mistaken. By means of such business, she is able to support the household expenses of her family. 

Given this situation, Merlita desires a higher income. In connection to this, she is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, spices, string beans and squash. She hopes to rapidly gain income through the loan in order to save for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, spices, string beans and squash

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en: Felicidad is a mother of 6 children. She supports their daily needs from buying and selling fruits and vegetables. She is 66 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Felicidad earns 2,000 PHP each month and has operated this business for 20 years. She requested a loan of 4,300 PHP to buy more vegetables to sell. Felicidad has been a member of Kiva's partner GDMPC since 2007. Felicidad hopes to make an expansion of her business soon.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a 54-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been teaching for 10 years. His personal goal is educating children and he also wishes to set up an income-generating activity so as to stop depending on the salary alone. Julius intends to use the money to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Nancy Marisol

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Progreso Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Nancy, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, pero aun viven con ella a pesar de que uno de ellos está casado y vive con su esposa. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca. 

Ella para ganar algo por su cuenta se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos de Avon y Esika (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas) y ropa, trabaja todos los días más que todo en las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedido, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, ya son 13 años que viene dedicada  a este tipo de ventas y le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene bastante clientela. Lo que más vende son los cosméticos y los perfumes.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 13 años  y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es seguir aumentado su negocio.
texts.en:
The “Sea of Progress” Community Bank meets every 15 days in the beautiful resort of San Mateo in the city of Manta. This place is known for its beautiful beaches, which are visited year around by local and foreign tourists. In this place most of the people are fisherman or do work involving the sea. 
Here we meet Mrs. Nancy, 43 years old, married with two grown children. They live with her even though one is married and lives with his wife. Her husband is a fisherman.
Nancy, in order to earn income, sells products though catalogues such as Avon and Esika (beauty items, perfumes and feminine accessories). She also sells clothes. She works everyday, mostly in the mornings, as the mornings are easier to make her rounds. She sells door to door. When she gets an order she offers layaway plans. She collects the payments weekly. She has been doing this work for the past 13 years. It has been going well and she has a strong customer base. She mostly sells cosmetics and perfumes.
With this loan she will buy clothes, perfume, jewelry, cosmetics and creams. She has been part of the community bank for the past thirteen years. She appreciates the assistance of the loans. 
Her dream is to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfumes, jewelry, cosmetics and creams.

loans.name: Nounagnon Group

texts.fr: NOUNAGNON est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe du nom de Dorcas Abemiachi (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgé de 51 ans. Dorcas Abemiachi est mariée à un certain Honoré. Le couple a sept enfants tous scolarisé et à leur charge. Dorcas Abemiachi vit ensemble avec les enfants et son mari et assure avec son mari les charges de la maison. Dorcas Abemiachi n’a pas fréquenté l’école.  Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Dorcas Abemiachi mène comme activité la vente de la nourriture appelée communément "atassi" (repas fait à base du riz et de l’haricot) dans son quartier depuis cinq ans. Dorcas Abemiachi s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse et de se faire plus de profit, Dorcas Abemiachi sollicite, ensemble avec les autres  membres du groupe NOUNAGNON, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Nounagnon is a group of three persons who reside in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group named Dorcas Abemiachi (whose hand is raised in the photo) is 51 years old.

Abemiachi Dorcas is married to Honoré. The couple has seven children, all attending (or having attended) school, and who are their dependents. Dorcas Abemiachi lives with her ​​husband and children and ensures with her husband the household expenses.

Dorcas Abemiachi has not attended school. To meet her various responsibilities, she runs a business selling food commonly called "Atassi" (a meal based ​​on rice and beans). She has been doing this in the neighborhood for five years. Dorcas Abemiachi gets her supplies in one of Benin's markets.

To better meet ever-increasing customer demands and to make more profit, Dorcas Abemiachi is requesting, together with other Nounagnon group members, a third loan from ALIDé. Previous loans have been fully repaid.

loans.use: Buy bags of rice, beans and condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other agricultural supplies

loans.name: Leyda Jessica

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Progreso Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Leyda, tiene 25 años de edad, está casada hace varios años pero aun no ha podido tener hijos pero espera que muy pronto lleguen para que alegren su hogar. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
 
Ella para sentirse útil y ganar algo por su cuenta por el bien de familia se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos de Avon y Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas) y ropa, su formas de venta es puerta a puerta, sale todos los días a recorrer la localidad ofreciendo sus productos y cobrando ya que deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días,  ella aprovecha cuando llegan los pescadores ya que es cuando ellos cogen dinero y es cuando mas compran sus productos. Lleva dos años en sus ventas y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pantalones, camisetas, perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas.  Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 3 años y le gusta porque los créditos son muy importantes para financiar su negocio. 

Su sueño es tener dos hijos para sentirse realizada como mujer.
texts.en:
The “Sea of Progress” Community Bank meets every 15 days in the beautiful resort of San Mateo in the city of Manta. This place is known for its beautiful beaches, which are visited year around by local and foreign tourists. In this place most of the people are fisherman or do work involving the sea. 
In this place we meet Mrs. Leyda. She is 25 and has been married for a while. She has not had children yet but hopes to have them soon as they enliven the house. Her husband is a fisherman.
She would like to be helpful and have her own earnings, which is why she sells Avon and Yanbal items from a catalogue (beauty articles, cosmetics, perfumes and feminine accessories), and clothes. She sells these items door to door. She goes out everyday, walking around her neighborhood offering these products and collecting money every eight days from those who pay with credit. She benefits when the fishermen arrive, as that is when they have money and when they buy her products. She has been doing this work for the past two years and it has been going well.
With this loan she will buy pants, shirts, perfumes, jewelry, cosmetics and creams. She has been in the community bank for the past three years and she likes it as it helps her finance her business.
Her dream is to have two children in order to feel like a real woman.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, perfumes, jewelry, cosmetics and creams.

loans.name: Marina Isabel

texts.es: La señora Marina , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su familia , los planes hacia su familia es terminar de construir la cocina y sala de la vivienda , para mejorar sus condiciones  de vida , su esposo labora en una empresa privada para poyarle con los gastos del hogar , ya que tienen una bebé , doña Marina desde hace varios años trabaja para una empresa privada , pero su sueldo no le ajusta para poder comprar de una sola vez todos los materiales de construcción que necesita para terminar la construcción  . El préstamo no necesita para comprar , arena , cemento , hierro , entre otros .
texts.en:
Sra. Marina lives with her family in the municipality of Ticuantepe. Her goal is to finish building the kitchen and living room of her house and thus improve her family’s living conditions. Her husband works for a private company and helps her pay for household expenses. They have a baby girl. 

For several years Marina has worked for a private company but her wages do not cover the cost of buying all the needed construction materials at one time. She is seeking a loan to buy sand, cement, rebar etc.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Stanely

texts.en:
Stanely is 37 years old and married to Prudence and they have one child. He sells  green peas and has been in the business for the past 10 years.

This is his first loan. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET client. He will use the loan amount to purchase more peas for resale in his business.

Stanely hopes to supply to hotels to increase his income.

loans.use: Purchase stock of green peas from farmers for sale.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en: Rogelio is 55 years old and is married to Milagros. He devotes himself full-time to taking care of his rice farm business. When the harvest comes, his hard work means that he can sell good quality products to increase his net profits. His income is about PHP 34,000 every season (every five months). He has fifteen years of experience in this field. His wife manages their hog-raising business and earns additional income to help meet their daily needs. As of now, Rogelio is requesting a PHP 38,000 loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and insecticide for his farm business. He hopes to increase his crop production.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and insecticide for his farm business

loans.name: Jahaira Katty

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Progreso Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Jahaira, tiene 21 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una niña de dos años de edad. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
 
Ella para poder ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y de su pequeña hija, se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa lugar hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de alguna prenda o cuando lleva mercadería nueva, ella sale a recorrer tres días a la semana más que todo en las mañanas ya que a esa hora su mamá le cuida  a su niña y así  ella puede realizar sus ventas más cómodamente,  deja a crédito a sus clientes más conocidos  y cobra cada 8 días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Lleva un año que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar uniformes  y ropa interior para niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace dos años y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos.

Su sueño es que a su hija no le falte nunca nada.
texts.en:
The “Sea of Progress” Community Bank meets every 15 days in the beautiful resort of San Mateo in the city of Manta. This place is known for its beautiful beaches, which are visited year around by local and foreign tourists. In this place most of the people are fisherman or do work involving the sea. 
Here we meet Mrs. Jahaira, who is 21 years old, married, with one two year old child. Her husband is a fisherman.
Jahaira, in order to have her own earnings and help her husband with household expenses and the expenses of her young daughter, sells all types of clothes. She sells them door to door and also from her house. Her customers come to her house when they need some clothes or they need new merchandise. She goes out to sell her items three days a week, mostly in the mornings as that is when her mother can care for her child. This is how she can easily do her work. She gives layaway to the customers that she knows well and she collects their payments every eight days. She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil as she needs it. She has been doing this job for the past year and it is going well.
With this loan she will buy uniforms and underclothes for children. She has been a member of the community bank for the past two years and she welcomes the help of the loans they offer. Her dream is that her daughter never lacks anything, ever.

loans.use: to buy uniforms and underclothes for children.

loans.name: Danilo Antonio

texts.es: El señor Danilo , es un humilde comerciante de frutas y verduras , el habita en la CONCEPCION , su esposa lava y plancha para apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar , ya que ellos tienen hijos , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida , principalmente terminar de construir su casita , pero sus ingresos económicos no le permite que haga la inversión de una sola vez, ya que con lo que gana es para la comida de su familia , agradece el apoyo que le brinda Kiva ya que con el préstamo anterior logro mejorar su negocio y ahora con este préstamo lo va a invertir en materiales de construcción.
texts.en: Danilo is a humble seller of fruit and vegetables who lives in Concepción. His wife washes and irons clothes to help with household expenses, since they have children. Their plans for the future are to improve their living conditions, mainly by finishing to build their small house, but their income is not enough to allow them to make such an investment all at once, since Danilo's earnings go towards buying food for his family. Danilo thanks Kiva for its support, which enabled him thanks to a previous loan to improve his shop. This loan is destined to buy construction materials.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Noutin

texts.fr: Noutin est âgé de 52 ans et vit au Benin. Noutin n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Noutin est marié à Adjimon. Le couple a six enfants à leur charge dont quatre constituent leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Noutin vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Noutin mène comme activité l’agriculture dans sa région depuis vingt ans. Noutin cultive en effet, le maïs, le manioc et de l'arachide. Noutin achète ses produits également dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’améliorer son activité, Noutin sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Noutin is 52 years old and lives in Benin. He did not attend school. He is married to Adjimon. They support six children, of whom four are their own. All of the children have had schooling. Noutin lives together with his wife and children. The couple jointly ensure that the diverse household expenses are covered. 

Noutin has been running a farm in his region for twenty years. Basically, he grows corn, cassava, and peanuts. He purchases his goods in the region, too. 

Seeking to satisfy his customers, and with the aim of improving his business, Noutin is requesting a fifth loan from ALIDé. The loan received previously were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy corn, cassava, and peanuts for planting

loans.name: Laurent

texts.fr: Laurent est âgé de 29 ans et vit au Bénin. Laurent est marié à Yvette. Le couple a trois enfants à leur charge dont deux sont leurs propres enfants. Certains enfants sont scolarisés. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de la famille, Laurent fait la transformation de noix de palme et vend aussi de façon secondaire de bois de chauffage et de l’élevage depuis sept ans au Nigeria. Laurent s’approvisionne dans des régions du Benin. Grâce au revenu que lui génèrent ses activités, Laurent contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Laurent sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Lawrence is 29 years old and lives in Benin. He is married to Yvette. The couple has three children under their care, of whom two are their own children. Some of the children are in school. The children live with their parents, and the couple shares responsibility for all the various household expenses.

To contribute to the family's diverse needs, Lawrence processes palm nuts and secondarily sells firewood and livestock. He has done this for the past seven years in Nigeria. Lawrence resupplies in different regions within Benin. With the income generated by his business, Lawrence contributes to various expenses of his family.

To meet the needs of an increasing number of customers, Lawrence is requesting a second loan from ALIDé. The first loan was repaid in full.

loans.use: Buy palm nuts.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia was born in 1960. She is married and blessed with seven children. She shares three  rooms with her seven children and her husband, where she lives in Ntsualam  a quarter in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon.

She has faced difficulties in her life ranging from ill-health, the inability to meet her daily needs, failure to attain quality education and sickness of her children. Amongst other challenges, she also has had difficulties in the raising capital to start up a business of her own 

With this loan, she plans to buy pig feed for retail around her community, fertilizer  to increase  her farm produced and  piglets which will also  buy some of the pig feed to feed  her own piglets .Part of the money will be used to transport  the feed from the Bamenda Central town to her quarter Ntsualam  where her feed store is located. She thinks her business will succeed because in the area where she stays, there is  no pig feed stores or any animal feed store but most people rear animals especially pigs.  She also says that she will use the pig dung as manure for her farm which will also go a long way to increased yield and food in her commuinty.

This activity will help her community in that other women in her area will be able to get manure from her pig farm and people in her community will be able to buy their pig feed by their door steps thus reducing the cost of transportation.

She will use a part of her profit to pay tuition fees for her children, provide food for her family and also cater for their health. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives, the follow-up and the low cost of obtaining and paying back a loan.

loans.use: to pay for pig feed, piglets and fertilizer

loans.name: Angela Eulalia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Progreso Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar vive la señora Angela, tiene 35 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 17,  9,  6 y 3 años de edad, el mayor de ellos estudia en colegio y los dos siguientes en escuela. El marido se dedica a la pesca.

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa, allí además de vender víveres también vende ciertos remedios y útiles escolares.  En las tardes con la finalidad de ganar algo extra vende las deliciosas empanadas de verde que son muy apetecidas por sus clientes que se reúnen muy cerca de su local a compartir entre amigos, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus  hijos y su esposo le ayudan en su trabajo cuando pueden. Tiene más de diez años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes y útiles escolares que es lo más necesita actualmente. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 3 años y le gusta porque con los créditos ha podido surtir más su negocio.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The Progreso Del Mar Community Bank meets every two weeks in the lovely seaside area of San Mateo in the town of Manta. It is known for its beautiful beaches open year round for local and overseas visitors. Most of the local people earn their living from fishing and associated work. 

35-year old Sra. Angela lives here with her partner. They have four children aged 17, 9, 6, and 3. The eldest goes to high school, and the next two attend primary school. Angela’s partner is a fisherman.

She runs a store out of her house selling groceries, medicines, and school supplies. Then in the afternoons to earn a little extra money she sells delicious empanadas much enjoyed by her customers who meet their friends near her store. She works every day from 6am to 8pm and sometimes even later. Her children and husband help her with the work when they can. Angela has been doing this work for more than ten years and it is going well. 

She is planning to use the loan money to buy stock for her store; she most needs rice, sugar, oil, detergent, and school supplies. She has been a member of the Community Bank for three years and likes it because with the loans she has been able to better stock her store. Her goal is to continue improving the store.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, and school supplies

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es: El señor Carlos, es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su familia, los planes hacia un  futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida, don Carlos labora en una moto taxi en el municipio donde habita, con el primer préstamo logro mejorar la moto y gracias al apoyo que le brinda Kiva a logrado mejorar sus servicios de taxi. Ahora el necesita el préstamo para invertirlo en su humilde vivienda ya que esta es de tablas ya muy deterioradas. Para el es muy importante ya que se aproxima el invierno y no quiere que se le pase el agua  y estar en malas condiciones de salud por el agua que se acumulan y crecen mosquitos que los pueden picar y causar dengue .
texts.en: Carlos lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe with his family. His plans for the future are to improve their living conditions. Carlos works as a motorcycle taxi driver in his municipality. With his previous loan, he managed to improve his motorcycle; thanks to Kiva's support, he managed to improve his taxi service. He now needs a loan to invest in his humble dwelling, the materials of which are very run-down. It is very important for him because winter is coming and he does not want to suffer water damage, which could lead to poor health due to the water accumulating and becoming a breeding ground for mosquitos, exposing Carlos to the risk of contracting dengue from a bite.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Nery Piedad

texts.es: Nery tiene 42 años. Nació en Los Ríos pero actualmente vive en Guayaquil. Está casada con José Mieles quien es taxista y tienen un hijo menor que asiste a la escuela pública. Siempre le ha gustado la moda, desde muy pequeña aprendió  ya que su mamá era costurera. Cuando se caso su esposo la apoyo y empezó su negocio comprando una máquina de coser. Nos cuenta que su profesión es cansada ya que no tiene horario. Cuando la producción es grande sus días empiezan a las 8 de la mañana y terminan a las 11 de la noche. Cuando la producción es baja se preocupa porque su economía recae en su esposo quien es taxista. En la temporada invernal es más difícil ya que el agua y lodo no ayudan en ambos negocios. El préstamo lo necesita para comprar una nueva máquina de coser, telas, hilos para la producción en la temporada escolar.  Sus planes futuros es poner un atelier, dar empleo y brindarle un mejor futuro a su hijo.
texts.en: Nery is 42 years old. She was born in Los Ríos, but she now lives in Guayaquil. She is married to José Mieles who is a taxi driver and they have a dependent child that goes to public school. She has always loved sewing. She has been sewing since she was a child. She learned the skill from her mother, who is a seamstress. When she got married, her husband supported her and she started her business by purchasing a sewing machine. She tells us that her profession is tiring as she works many hours. When she has a lot of work, she starts work at eight in the morning and doesn’t finish until eleven at night. When business is slow she is concerned as then they are only dependent upon the earnings of her husband, who is a taxi driver. Wintertime is more difficult as the rain and mud do not help either of their businesses. She would like this loan in order to buy a new sewing machine, fabrics, and thread in order to make clothes for the school year. Her plans for the future are to have a workshop, hire other workers and to have a better future for her child.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, fabric and thread.

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rosa, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, para realizar la compra de materiales para la elaboración de tamales, el maíz, pollo, condimentos, aceite, hojas de banano, entre otros ingredientes que son parte de la preparación de los tamales.
Ella considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo para tener a la mano lo necesario, realizando una mayor producción y mejorar sus ventas, su condición con la familia ha mejorado.
texts.en:
Rose is asking for this new loan in order to buy new materials to make tamales, such as corn, chicken, condiments, oil and banana leaves among other ingredients that are needed for the preparation of tamales.
The last loan she received helped her to have available the necessary ingredients she needed to produce the most tamales and improve her sales. Her family’s conditions have improved.

loans.use: to buy corn, chicken, condiments, oil and banana leaves.

loans.name: Clemenia

texts.en: Clemenia is 50 years old, married, and has 4 children. Clemenia is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Clemenia used her last loan to purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell. Her business has grown and become successful. Now, she's taking a new loan to purchase fertilizer. This is for her banana production business.  She hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is a married woman from the town of Cabatuan, in the province of Isabela, Philippines. She and her husband are both farmers who primarily grow crops of rice to sell. Lolita has requested a loan amounting to PHP 30,000 to purchase quality seeds, fertilizers, and other farming supplies. Lolita does her best to improve their business and take care of their children. She hopes to have a bigger farm in the future, and to help improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase quality seeds, fertilizers, and other farming supplies

loans.name: Mansavo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MANSAVO est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Vicentia est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Vicentia est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur nommé Elie. Vicentia n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple a deux enfants, tous à leur charge, mais dont un est scolarisé. Vicentia vit ensemble avec son mari et ses deux enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Vicentia vend depuis une quinzaine d'année, du pain, des condiments et du riz dans son quartier. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Vicentia s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Vicentia sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MANSAVO, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group MANSAVO comprises three persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative,  Vicentia, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 35 years old and married to a driver named Elie. Vicentia did not attend school. The couple has two children, both in their care, including one in school. Vicentia lives together with her husband and two children. The couple share in the different household expenses.
