Another client introduced her to KADET LTD and this is her first loan.  She will use this loan to purchase more handbags to stock and sell in her business.  

In the future, she hopes to acquire a permanent location from which to operate her business.

loans.use: to purchase more handbags to stock and sell.

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.ru: Илхом житель города Исфара. Ему 36 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Он развозит пассажиров по маршруту Исфара-Чилгази. В этой области Илхом восемь лет. Он берет кредит для ремонта машины марки ГАЗЕЛЬ.
texts.en: Ilhom is a resident of the city of Isfara.  He is 36 years old, married and has four children.  He transports passengers along the Isfara-Chilgazi route.  Ilhom has been in this business for eight years.  He is requesting this loan to repair his Gazel vehicle.

loans.use: to repair his Gazel vehicle

loans.name: Hatem

texts.en:
Hatem is 36 years old and married.  He lives in Gaza. He has a coffee shop; which he has owned since June 2007. 

Hatem is requesting a loan, which he will use to expand the size of his coffee shop and buy new chairs. He hopes that this loan will improve his business and increase his income.

loans.use: to expand the size of his coffee shop and buy new chairs.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena tiene 59 años es casada con 04 hijos independientes. Con su trabajo y esfuerzo Elena ha cumplido algunos de sus objetivos como apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios Universitarios, construir parte de su casa y mantener su negocio.  Ella  cuenta con una tienda la cual ofrece productos de primera necesidad,  empezó en este rubro hace varios años, aprendió mucho de su hermano mayor quien  contaba con dicho negocio, también nos comenta que ofrece servicios de cocina. Elena  se siente satisfecha ya que puede colaborar con su familia que es lo más importante. Elena  invertirá el préstamo en la compra de vinos y licores ya que piensa ofrecer en su tienda.  Ella está agradecida a Edaprospo por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
Elena, 59, is married and has four independent children.  With her work and effort Elena met some of her objectives which were to provide her children with university educations, to build part of her house and to maintain her business.  

She has a store where she sells basic staple items.  She started this line of work many years ago.  She learned much from her older brother who had said business and she also tells us that she also offers cooking services.  

Elena feels satisfied because she can collaborate with her family which is what’s most important.  Elena will use the loan to buy wine and liquor that she plans to offer in her store.  She is grateful to Edaprospo for the granted loan.

loans.use: to buy wine and liquor.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia es socia del Bancomunal Morenita II,tiene 60 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de comida y también es dueña de una chacra, es socia de Finca Perú hace 2 años, gracias a las capacitaciones de su Bancomunal ella aprendió muchas cosas,como ahorrar, ser puntual y también le pudo ayudar con la educación de sus hijos, esta muy agradecida porque le dieron la oportunidad de trabajar y así progresar, ahora el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de una cocina para su negocio.
texts.en:
Julia’s a member of the “Morenita II” communal bank.  She’s 60 years old and sells food.  She also owns a piece of farmland.  

She’s been a member of Finca Perú for two years.  Thanks to her communal bank’s training she’s learned many things like how to save, to be punctual and she was also able to get help with her children’s education.  

She’s very grateful because they gave her the opportunity to work and make progress.  The loan she’s asking for now is to buy a stove for her business.

loans.use: to buy a stove.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is single. 

To earn a living, Jean has a business selling different kinds of fish.  She earns about 7,000 PHP per month doing this type of work.  Jean has requested a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP in order to buy a variety of fish including, milk fish, flying fish, carpa, dalagang bukid and tulingan.

Jean has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Jean hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish including, milk fish, flying fish, dalagang bukid and tulingan.

loans.name: Sanoat

texts.ru: Саноат, женщина -предприниматель, которая имеет свой небольшой бизнес. Она у дома торгует продуктами питания.У неё три взрослых сына и дочка восьми лет.Один из сыновей в отъезде в Р.Ф на заработках.Каждый месяц присылает маме на расходы семьи.Муж Саноат работает водителем такси.Текущий кредит у Саноат второй по счёту.Первый кредит она потратила на ремонт своего мини магазинчика, а теперь хочет закупить товар первой необходимости для жизни.В основном она торгует продуктами питания,мукой, макаронами, сахаром,и т.п. Саноат на снимке в день выдачи. Она благодарна всем инвесторам "Арванд" за поддержку и понимание.
texts.en: Sanoat is a woman-entrepreneur, who has a small business.  She sells food products by her house.  She has three adult sons and an eight-year-old daughter.  One of the sons is in the Russian Federation for work.  He sends money to his mother every month for family's expenses.  Sanoat's husband works as a taxi driver.  This is Sanoat's second loan.  She spent her first loan on repairing her mini-market and now wants to purchase essential products.  She primarily sells food products, such as flour, pasta, sugar and the like.  The photograph shows Sanoat on the day of loan disbursement.  She is grateful to all "Arvand" investors for the support and understanding.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Gbenonkpo 3 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBENONKPO 3 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Jocelyne Ablawa est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Jocelyne Ablawa est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à un certain Waïbi. Jocelyne Ablawa n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple a quatre enfants à leur charge dont trois constituent leurs propres enfants. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Jocelyne Ablawa vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Jocelyne Ablawa vend depuis quatre ans de kaolin et de façon secondaire de savons dans un marché du Benin. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Jocelyne Ablawa s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et parfois à Lomé. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Jocelyne Ablawa sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBENONKPO 3, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le  premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The GBENONKPO 3 group is made up of three friends. This is the second time that the group is seeking financial aid from ALIDé, in order to increase their level of business.

Jocelyne Ablawa, who is raising her hand in the photograph, is the group's representative. She is 37 years old and married to a man named Waïbi. Jocelyne Ablawa did not go to school. The couple has four children living in their care, three of whom are their biological children. Some of the children receive schooling. Jocelyne Ablawa lives with her husband and children. The couple covers the various household expenses together.

In order to contribute to supporting her family, Jocelyne Ablawa has been selling kaolin and some soap on the side in a market in Benin for the past four years. This business allows her to meet the needs of her family without much difficulty. Jocelyne Ablawa stocks up at a market in Benin and sometimes in Lomé.

Striving to satisfy her customers and increase her sales revenue, Jocelyne Ablawa, along with the other members of the GBENONKPO 3 group, is seeking a second loan from ALIDé. The first loan was correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy boxes of soap and bags of kaolin

loans.name: 05.08.50 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lương operates a food stall/restaurant where she sells fruit. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell. Lương has been involved in this business for six years.

Lương is 41 years old and married with two children.

Lương is the group leader of the 05.08.50 Điện Biên solidarity group, which consists of five members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, a semi-urban area in the Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Lương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Lương has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Lương faces in her business is a lack of capital.

Lương's dreams are for her children to find good jobs, her business to do well and her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell.

loans.name: Señor De Puquin Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron hace varios años el banco comunal “Señor de Puquin” en la provincia del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por 11 once personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de las socias son por ejemplo; venta de artesanía, venta de ropa, venta de comida, alquiler de taxis y otros brindan servicios como albañil y empleada de una empresa privada.
 
(El socio  Alejandro está levantando la mano en la fotografía). El señor Alejandro nació en la ciudad de Zurite provincia de Anta, tiene 50 años de edad y es casado y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos. Su actividad económica principal de Alejandro es brindar servicio de taxi en la ciudad del Cusco. En esta oportunidad Alejandro requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de su carro.

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística por sus centros arqueológicos por su centro histórico por sus paisajes por su historia y siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.

(Las socias que aparecen en la parte inferior de la fotografia llegaron tarde a la reunion).
texts.en:
A group of friends and neighbors formed the “Señor de Puquin” communal bank several years ago in Cusco Province.  This communal bank has 11 members who look for opportunities to get ahead at every moment and to provide a better future for their children through their efforts.  The economic activities of members for example are:  crafts sales, clothing sales, food sales, taxi services; some offer bricklaying services and work as employees in private firms.

Alejandro is raising his hand in the photo.  He was born in the city of Zurite, Anta Province.  He’s 50 years old, married and has two children.  Alejandro’s main economic activity is providing taxi services in the city of Cusco.  On this occasion, Alejandro needs the loan to service his car.

The members in general are grateful for the opportunity provided and commit to make their installment payments according to the established schedule.

Cusco is located in Cusco District and Province in Cusco Department in the very heart of the ancient city of the Incas.  It’s noted for being a very touristy area because of its archaeological sites, its historic city center, for its scenery and history and for being an enchanting city in the southern region of the country.  Cusco is known for being very touristy, commercial and for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because one of the seven wonders of the world, Machupicchu, is found here.

(The members who appear at the bottom of the photograph arrived late at the meeting).

loans.use: to service his car.

loans.name: Efraim

texts.en: Ephraim is a forty eight year old married man with three children living in Kasese,Uganda. He has been in the poultry business for three years. He started with 100,000 shillings and now  has 2,000,000 shillings as working capital. His hardship is inadequate capital to purchase stock. His personal goal is educating his children and his business goal is expanding his business into new markets. Ephraim will use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a 26-year-old married woman with three children living in Kagadi, Uganda.  She is a teacher by profession and has been in service for a period of one year.  

She also deals in spare parts, a business she started by using the savings from her salary.  Juliet is requesting a loan to buy spare parts for resale.  She says price fluctuations and inadequate capital are the main factors hindering this business.  

In the future, Juliet would like to educate her children, upgrade her studies and build a permanent house.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Grimaldina Juana

texts.es: Grimaldina es socia del Bancomunal Iris Lanao, tiene 38 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de frutas, es madre de 4 hijos, es socia de FINCA Perú hace 1 año,ella aprendió a trabajar,a ahorrar, y a administrar su dinero, esta muy agradecida por todo lo que aprendió en su Bancomunal  y porque que le ayudaron también con la educación de sus hijos, ella siente que esta progresando porque los préstamos le ayudaron a incrementar el capital de su negocio, ahora el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de fruta para su negocio.
texts.en: Grimaldina’s a member of the “Iris Lanao” communal bank.  She’s 38 years old and is a fruit merchant.  She’s the mother of four children and has been a member of Finca Perú for a year.  She learned how to work, to save and to manage her money.  She’s very grateful for everything she’s learned in her communal bank and because they helped her with her children’s education.  She feels that she’s making progress because the loans helped her increase her business’ capital.  The loan she’s requesting now is to buy fruit for her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Claudio Noel

texts.es: Claudio Noel tiene 32 años de edad, trabaja en una empresa de la localidad donde tiene años de trabajar en el mismo lugar. Claudio Noel tiene dos hijos que todavía están a su cargo y están estudiando, su mayor sueño es que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y acondicionar su vivienda donde habitan que por falta de dinero no las había realizado, está solicitando crédito para realizarle  las mejoras a su vivienda lo cual compra arena, cemento, entre otros materiales de construcción.
texts.en: Claudio Noel, 32, works in a firm in his locality; he’s been working in the same place for many years.  Claudio Noel has two children still in his care who are attending school.  His greatest dream is that his children complete their schooling and to upgrade his house that for lack of money he’s been unable to do so far.  He’s asking for a loan to do the home improvements.  He will buy sand and cement, among other building supplies.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement, among other building supplies.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos is 43 years old and married with three school-aged children. He raises his family in a rural community where he plants and harvests rice and vegetables for sale. He aims to uplift his family's standard of living and to continue to send his children to school and give them a better future. 

Carlos plans to expand his plantation to increase his yields. However, due to insufficient capital, he is asking for an additional loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed for his rice-farming business. He is hoping that his patience and hard work will bear good fruit some day.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed for his rice-farming business.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La señora María , es habitante del municipio de la concepción , junto a su esposo , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , doña María desde muy joven trabaja al campo ya que fueron sus padres quien le inculcaron trabajar las tierras para que dieran frutos y de esos se alimentara ella y su familia , doña María enfrenta una gran situación económica en cuanto al cultivo ya que no tiene los recursos necesarios para poderle dar el mantenimiento que requiere el cultivo de cítricos como el limón , naranjas dulces y agrias , entre otros ; ya que es la única fuente de ingresos que tiene para poder salir adelante y llevar comida a su hogar . El préstamo lo quiere para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y logre sacar un cosecha buena .
texts.en:
Señora María, along with her husband, is a resident of the municipality of La Concepción.  The plans she has for her family are to improve their living conditions.  

Since Doña María was very young she has worked in the fields because that was where her parents had her working the land so that it would bear fruit and with this she would feed herself and her family.  

Doña María faces a great financial situation with regard to the farm because she does not have the resources needed to be able to give the upkeep that is required for the cultivation of citrus fruits like the lemon and sweet and sour oranges, among others; and since this is the only source of income she has to be able to get ahead in life and bring food into her home.  She wants the loan in order to buy fertilizers and supplies to use on the farm and get a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es: Zenaida es socia del Bancomunal Morenita II, tiene 32 años de edad, se dedica a la confección de bordados en cintas,sabanas y cubrecamas, es socia de Finca Perú hace 1 año, esta muy agradecida por la ayuda que le dieron para trabajar y progresar. Está muy feliz porque sus ahorros están creciendo y ve como su vida también está cambiando, ahora el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de telas e hilos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Zenaida is 32, and a member of Bancomunal Morenita II communal bank. She  does embroidery on table runners, sheets and bedspreads, and has been a Finca Perú member for a year. 

She is very grateful for the help they have given her to work and progress. She is very happy because her savings are growing, and she sees how her life is also changing. Now she will use the loan she applying for to buy fabric and thread for her business.

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread for her business.

loans.name: Oscar Enrique

texts.es: El señor Oscar es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su familia , su esposa lava y plancha para apoyarlos con los gastos del hogar , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones económicas , don Oscar labora desde hace 20 años en una empresa privada , pero su sueldo no le ajusta para poder invertir de una sola vez en una cocina digna , ya que la actual es un fogón y la tiene a la intemperie ; pero la mayor preocupación de don Oscar es que se acerca la temporada de lluvia y se las hace difícil cocinar ya que se tiene que mojar todo y casi no encuentran leña para cocinar sus alimentos .El préstamo lo invertirá para comprar materiales de construcción y realizar la cocina.
texts.en: Oscar resides in Ticuantepe municipality with his family.  His wife takes in laundry and ironing to help with household expenses.  His plan for his family is to improve economic conditions.  Oscar has worked for 20 years for a private firm but his salary is insufficient to be able to pay for a proper kitchen all at once; he currently has an outdoor hearth and Oscar’s greatest concern is that the rainy season is approaching and cooking will be very difficult because everything gets wet and they can’t find firewood to cook their meals.  He will use the loan to buy building materials and supplies to build the kitchen.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Maruja Sofia

texts.es: Maruja es socia del Bancomunal Iris Lanao, tiene 34 años de edad, se dedica a la artesanía y a los telares, es socia de Finca Perú hace 1 año, es madre de 2 hijos, ella aprendió mucho en FINCA Perú, porque le ayudaron a poder tener los conocimientos para que su negocio prospere, las capacitaciones de su Bancomunal le ayudaron a aprender a como tratar sus clientes y como administrar su negocio.Ahora el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de hilos para la confección de telares para su negocio.
texts.en: Maruja’s a member of the “Iris Lanao” communal bank.  She’s 34 years old and works in crafts and in weaving.  She’s been a member of Finca Perú for a year.  She’s the mother of two children.  She’s learned much in Finca Perú because they helped her acquire the knowledge so that her business could prosper.  Training in her communal bank helped her learn how to treat her customers and how to run her business.  The loan she’s asking for now is to buy thread to weave her textiles for her business.

loans.use: to buy thread.

loans.name: Olimjon

texts.ru: Олимчон проживает в районе Кумсангир. Ему 26 лет. Он холост. Олимчон более шести лет занимается животноводством. В основном он откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа бычков.
texts.en: Olimjon lives in the Qumsangir district.  He is 26 years old and single.  Olimjon has been involved in animal husbandry for over six years.  He primarily fattens up and sells livestock.  He is requesting this loan to buy bulls.

loans.use: to buy bulls

loans.name: Carmen Maria

texts.es: La señora Carmen , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo e hijos , su esposo labora como bombero voluntario , ella desde hace varios años se dedica a la comercialización de frutas y verduras en los mercados capitalinos , los planes hacia su familia es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida , doña Carmen es de muy bajos recursos y lo poco que logra ganar en sus ventas diarias es para la alimentación de su familia .Ella necesita el apoyo de Kiva para poder comprar zinc y perlines ya que el que tiene parece un pazcón de tantos hoyos y lo sostiene pedazos de madera ya viejos que dentro de poco ya ni servirán para leña.
texts.en:
Carmen lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe with her husband and children.  Her husband works as a volunteer fireman.  She’s been working for many years as a fruit merchant in markets in the capital. Her plan for the family is to improve their living conditions.  

Carmen is of very low resources and what little she earns from her daily sales is used to feed her family.  She needs Kiva’s help to buy metal sheets and purlines because the one she has looks like a sieve it has so many holes and it’s held up by pieces of old lumber that pretty soon won’t even be good for firewood.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting and purlines.

loans.name: La Ilusion De Huitzililla Group

texts.es: Las integrantes del grupo siguen en la actividad que vienen desarrollando. La señora Delfina tiene 55 años de edad ella es casada, ella tiene 8 hijos, 2 mujeres y 6 varones todos son casados ya trabajan ella vende ToperWare, perfumes y cosméticos de Jafra por catalogo, ella también vende pan, ella sale a vende sus productos por las calles de su comunidad, el negocio del pan era de su papa pero el murió, así que ella siguió con el negocio, su negocio es importante porque obtiene ganancias y es muy conocido por el sabor del pan, ella inicio su negocio hace 14 años la invito una amiga a vender productos de Jafra y toperware, ella se siente orgullosa de vender el pan y terminar toda su mercancía. Ella está contenta con este préstamo que va a recibir va a comprar mercancía para vender. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por su ayuda, con sus préstamo podemos crecer los negocios”.
texts.en:
The group members are still doing the activities they have been carrying out up to now. Delfina is 55, married, and has eight children: two girls and 6 boys, all married and working.

She sells Tupperware, perfumes and Jafra cosmetics by catalog. She also sells bread, and goes out to sell her products on the streets of her community. Her bread business was her father's; but he died, so she continued with the business. Her business is important because she makes profits, and it is very well-known for the flavor of the bread.  

She started her business 14 years ago when a girlfriend invited her to sell Jafra products and Tupperware. She feels proud to sell bread, and to finish selling all her merchandise. She is happy about the loan she is going to receive, and will use it to buy merchandise to sell. 

The group members wish to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad:  “Thank you for your help. With your loans we can make the businesses grow."

loans.use: To buy Tupperware, perfumes, Jafra cosmetics, and buy bread.

loans.name: Sandra Vanesa

texts.es: Sandra casada, emprendedora, comerciante, su esposo trabaja como albañil, su negocio es la venta de cosméticos, perfumes y otros por catalogo. Proyectos mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda, también generar mayores utilidades, cambiando su nivel de vida y opcionando a ofrecer un mejor futuro a su hijo. Tiene su negocio desde hace tiempo empezándolo para que existiera un ingreso más al hogar cubriendo mejor los gastos. Iniciándolo con fondos propios, actualmente todo lo vendido lo invierte nuevamente inversión y utilidades.Necesita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como: laminas de zinc, perlines, golosos, soldadura, cemento, arena, piedrín, hoja de sierra, cener entre otros para repellar las paredes y cambiar el techo. Con esta inversión obtendrá seguridad y comodidad para su familia. Agradece el apoyo a la oportunidad de optar un crédito para mejorar sus condiciones de la infraestructura de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sandra is an enterprising merchant.  She is married, and her husband is a bricklayer.  Her business is selling cosmetics, perfumes, and others by catalog.  

Her projects are to improve the infrastructure of her house, to generate more profits, to change her standard of living, and to offer her son a better future.

She has had her business for some time.  She started it to get another income to better cover the household expenses.  She started it with her own funds.  At the present time she invests everything she sells, her profits, in the business again.

She needs the loan to buy construction materials like zinc sheeting, purlines, screws, solder, cement, sand, gravel, a saw blade, and thinner, among others in order to plaster the walls and change the roof.  

With this investment her family will be safe and comfortable.  She is grateful for the opportunity to get a loan in order to improve her the conditions of the infrastructure of her house.

loans.use: to change the roof and plaster the walls of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron sheets, sand, and cement to construct her residential house.

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky patiently manages her mini-grocery at Baggao. She sells noodles, sardines, soap and other basic kitchen needs. She had acquired regular customers to buy from her store because of the friendly services and affordable prices she offers. She would like to keep acquiring good profits from her store in order to save enough funds for her children's school expenses. She would like to increase her merchandise so she is now asking for a loan of PHP 28,000 to buy canned goods, beverages, eggs, noodles and biscuits to sell in her store. 

Jinky's spouse is a farmer and they have three children. In the future, she would like to became a successful entrepreneur and provide all her family's needs for a successful life.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, eggs, noodles and biscuits to sell in her store.

loans.name: Altynbubu

texts.ru: Алтынбюбю 47 лет, вдова, живет совместно с сыном. В качестве  источника дохода для семьи, в 2000 году Алтынбюбю начала   заниматься животноводством.  На сегодня ее хозяйство насчитывает 15 овец, а также Алтынбюбю возделывает  3га земли, где сеет яровые. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Алтынбюбю обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров и грубых кормов. Доходы Алтынбюбю планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего  хозяйства.
texts.en: Altynbubu is 47 years old, a widow and lives together with her son.  To provide a source of income for her family, she became involved in animal husbandry in 2000.  Today, her business contains 15 sheep.   Altynbubu also works on 3 hectares of land, where she sows spring crops.  In order to further develop her business, Altynbubu requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy dairy cows and fodder.  She plans to invest the earnings into a continued expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina is a 43-year-old widow. She has three children: 
-	Mila, 25 and married; 
-	Dian, 20 and is attending the university;
-	David, 19 and working. 

Since the death of her husband in 2009, Agustina needs to work harder to support her family’s living expenses. With her own capital, Agustina initiated a business selling “nabas“ (rice with pork). 

Agustina usually works eight hours a day from 7 pm to 2 am. She runs the business in front of a shop building as she knows that the place is strategic. The profit from the business enables her to finance her family and the children's expenses as well.

A week ago, Agustina lost her money when someone stole it. This situation automatically affects her business. She is grateful that there was a loan officer who suggested she join TLM’s Lending Program. She is requesting a loan of IDR 4,500,000 from TLM to continue her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice and pork

loans.name: Vianney

texts.en:
Vianney is married. He has three children. They all go to school. He has been a rice farmer for 25 years. He would like to get this loan to buy fertilizers, and support labor costs to get the best harvest of rice. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more results.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Anacleto

texts.en:
Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, Anacleto Jr. aimed to increase his rice production to satisfy his family needs and finance the education of his three children. Despite problems and difficulties he encountered in farming, he has the determination to uplift his status of living. 

He planned to expand his rice plantation to ensure a high production, but due to inadequate capital, he is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides needed for his rice farming business. He believes that through patience and hard work, he will increase his production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is a 45-year-old married man with five children living in Kagadi, Uganda.He is a teacher by profession and has been in service for a period of nine years. In order to supplement his income, he also has a retail shop. He would like to educate his children, upgrade his studies and build a permanent home. Lawrence wants a loan to buy sodas and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy sodas and rice to sell

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en: Felicidad is 54 years old and married. She had been blessed with five children. She has a retail store based in her home and she is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase items such as biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar and other ingredients to sell. She has been running her business for 10 years and she is thankful because her income has been increasing. Her husband is her motivation for improving her business. She is working hard because she wants to have a better quality of life by doing something that brings in additional income. She hopes that she can get the loan amount she requested.

loans.use: to purchase items such as biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar and other ingredients to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more items like sugar, Macron, soap, cooking oil, biscuits, and many others.

loans.name: Benon

texts.en: Benon is a 35-year-old married man with five children living in Kagadi, Uganda. He has been working with the local government as a personnel officer and has been in service for nine years.He also has a produce business and he says it has been very profitable. He would like to educate his children and own a food store that can sustainably supply his customers .He wants a loan to buy maize, beans and groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and  groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Erika Patricia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Progreso Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Erika, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 9 y 3 años de edad, el mayor estudian en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella con la finalidad de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y de sus hijos, se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa si algún cliente quiere alguna prenda, trabaja tres a cuatro  días a la semana y cuando este desocupada no tiene un horario fijo para realizar sus recorridos, ella deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene dos años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y sobretodo interiores de niños, ya que en esta temporada por la entrada a clases es lo que más se vende. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace dos años  y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio que hoy le permite salir adelante.

Sus sueños es continuar hacia delante en su negocio y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.

La Señora Erika es que está en el primer plano de la foto con una camiseta a rayas.
texts.en:
The members of the “Progreso Del Mar” communal bank meet every two weeks in the beautiful San Mateo spa in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches which are visited by national and foreign tourists year round. Most of the people here fish or perform other labors of the sea.

Here we meet Erika.  She’s 30 years old, married, and as a result has two children, ages 9 and 3.  The oldest attends school.  Her husband is a fisherman.  

In order to be able to earn some money on her own and help her husband with the household expenses and help support the children, she sells clothing of all types.  She sells door to door and also out of her home if one of her customers needs something.  She works 3-4 days a week and whenever she’s free.  She doesn’t have a set schedule.  She sells on credit and collects every two weeks.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil every two weeks or once a month, depending on what she needs.  She’s been doing this for two weeks and things are going well for her.

She will use the money from this loan to buy merchandise, such as pants, blouses, shirts, and above all, children’s undergarments, now that the school season has begun and this is what she sells the most of.  She’s been a member of the communal bank for two years and she enjoys it because she started her business with the money from her first loan and this has helped her get ahead.

Her dreams are to continue moving forward in her business and provide the best for her children.

Erika is in the front of the photograph, wearing a stripped t-shirt.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Consolee

texts.en:
Consolee is single. She has been a rice farmer for six years. She would like to get this loan to buy fertilizer and pay labor costs to get the best harvest of rice. With the profits, she plans to expand the area she has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and pay labor costs

loans.name: Naneth

texts.en:
Naneth is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

To earn a living, Naneth has a business selling different kinds of fish. She earns about PHP 3,000 a month doing this type of work. Naneth has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy a variety of fish like milkfish, flying fish, dalagang bukid (yellow tail) and tilapia.

Naneth has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Naneth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of fish to sell

loans.name: Lenah

texts.en:
Lenah is 35 years old. She is married to Charles and together they have three children. She sells clothes and has been in the business for the past two years.

This is her first loan in KADET LTD. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a client. She will use the loan amount to purchase stock of clothes for resale in her business.

She hopes to establish a permanent business premise.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is 38 years old, and is married to Ariel, a farmer in the village where they live. Virginia is engaged in a direct selling business. She has been in this business for a year and earns about PHP 2,500 per month for these activities. She wants to buy more products from AVON to offer in the local community, but she lacks the necessary capital. In this regard, Virginia is asking a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy lotion, deodorant, cologne, and other items to resell in her village. She believes that she can improve the business through her patience and strong determination.

loans.use: to buy lotion, deodorant, cologne, and other items to resell in her village.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 54 years old.She is married to Samuel and together they have three children.She sells potatoes and has been in the business for the past two years.

This is her first loan in KADET LTD. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a client. She will use the loan amount to purchase bags of potatoes for resale in her business.

She hopes to purchase a plot of land on which plant potatoes instead of buying them.

loans.use: to buy bags of potatoes for resale in her business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 34-year-old married man with five children living in Kagadi, Uganda. He is a teacher by profession and has been in service for a period of nine years. He would like to educate his children and build a permanent house. Joseph wants a loan to buy iron sheets to roof his residential house.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets  to roof his residential house.

loans.name: Theonest

texts.en:
Theonest is single. He has been a rice farmer for two years. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers, and to support labor costs to get the best harvest in the rice production. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to increase output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and to support labor costs in rice production.

loans.name: Honoré Adohoungbo

texts.fr: Honoré Adohoungbo est âgé de 41 ans et vit au Bénin. Honoré Adohoungbo est marié à Marguerite. Honoré Adohoungbo  n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisé. En dehors de leurs enfants, le couple a deux autres enfants à leur charge. Honoré Adohoungbo et sa femme assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Honoré Adohoungbo mène comme activité la vente de pièces détachées depuis une dizaine d'année. Cette activité lui permet ainsi de satisfaire aux besoins de ses enfants et de subvenir à ses besoins. Honoré Adohoungbo désire rehausser le niveau de son activité ; ce qui lui permettra de répondre efficacement aux exigences de sa clientèle. Pour cette raison, Honoré Adohoungbo sollicite pour la deuxième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit précédent a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: Honoré Adohoungbo is 41 years old and lives in Benin. He is married to Marguerite. Honoré Adohoungbo didn’t go to school. The couple has five children, some of whom are in school. In addition to their own children, the couple cares for two other children. Honoré Adohoungbo and his wife share responsiblity for the household expenses. He has been selling spare parts for ten years to meet these expenses. This business enables him to meet the needs of his children and to earn a living.  Honoré Adohoungbo wants to build his business, which would allow him to respond effectively to client demand. For this reason, he is requesting a second loan from ALIDé. The previous loan has been fully repaid.

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Tiberious

texts.en:
Tiberious is a 32-year-old man from Wasweta in Migori and is married to Esther who is a pharmacist; they have two children, ages nine and six years old.

Tiberious sells household goods and has done so for the past seven years, earning a monthly income of KES. 6,000. He is taking s his first loan from KADET LTD, which he’s intending to use to buy more inventory of goods for resale. He plans to use his profits in paying his loan well and expanding his business.

His dream is to expand his business and own his home.

loans.use: to buy more household products for resale.

loans.name: Estefania

texts.en:
Estefania is from the village of Capellan, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 56 years old, married, and has adult-aged children. Estefania owns and operates a store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. With her vending business, she earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. Estefania joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.

In the future, Estefania hopes that her business can expand to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, coffee, snack foods and drinks for her store.

loans.name: Korinus

texts.en:
Korinus is a 31-year-old man and married to Selfina, a 30-year-old lady. They are blessed with a 5-year-old daughter named Kriseltia. Currently, they are expecting their second child.

Korinus initiated a motorcycle taxi business in 2003. From the income generated, Korinus was able to build a house for his mother and his family as well. 

Korinus was thinking of generating more money by purchasing corn to be resold. He would like to save some money for his wife's maternity costs. 

Therefore, he is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 4,000,000. He believes that through the business improvement, his income will increase.

loans.use: to purchase corn to sell

loans.name: Ginazio

texts.en: Ginazio is a 43-year-old gentleman who has six children and lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He has been trading in local brew for eight years. He started as a loan officer with a saving and cooperative society (Sacco) and after accumulating enough savings, he ventured in his current business. Price fluctuations and inadequate capital are factors affecting his operations. He would like to educate his children and for the business he would like to expand it into new markets. Ginazio wants a loan to buy local brew for resale.

loans.use: to buy local brew for resale.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is 49 years old and married with four children. He sells computer parts such as keyboards and mouse to earn a living. He has been in the business for 12 years and describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to pay school fees for his children and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy computer parts such as keyboards and mouse to sell.

loans.use: To buy computer parts such as keyboards to sell

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru: Нигина уже два года как занимается торговлей фруктов. Ей 33 года. Она разведена. У нее двое детей. Нигина берет кредит для покупки нескольких видов яблок, груши, огурцов и помидоров.
texts.en: Nigina has been involved in selling fruits for two years.  She is 33 years old, divorced and has two children.  Nigina is requesting this loan to buy several types of apples, pears, cucumbers and tomatoes.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Cemiliana

texts.en:
This is Cemiliana, 62, and a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is a widow with two children. She manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Cemiliana operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 23,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Cemiliana dreams of growing her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items and other products to sell

loans.name: Paula Katty

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Progreso Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Paula, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos, cuatro de ellos ya mayores de edad y el menor tiene 14 años, tres de ellos aun viven en su casa y dos estudian en universidad y el menor en colegio. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca. Pero actualmente está enfermo y no trabaja.

Ella para poder ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudar a su esposo y actualmente  poder cubrir los gastos de la casa, se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa lugar donde tiene unas vitrinas para ofrecer sus productos, ella sale a recorrer cuatro  días a la semana y los fines de semana vende en su local por los turistas que llegan hasta el lugar, vende de contado o deja a crédito a sus clientes más conocidos  y cobra cada 8 días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, ella empezó con el primer crédito que recibió de la institución.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa pero sobretodo uniformes  y ropa interior para niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres años  y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son que su esposo mejore y vuelva a sus faenas del mar ya que es muy difícil solventar los gastos ella sola.
texts.en:
The members of the “Progreso Del Mar” communal bank meet every two weeks in the beautiful San Mateo spa in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches which are visited by national and foreign tourists year round. Most of the people here fish or perform other labors of the sea.

Here we meet Paula.  She’s 50 years old, married and as a result has four adult children and one 14 year old.  Three of them still live at home and two attend university.  The youngest is in school.  Her husband is a fisherman, but he’s ill and not currently working. 

In order to be able to earn some money on her own and help her husband with the household expenses, she sells all types of clothing door to door and also out of her home, where she has some display cases where she can offer her products.  She goes out to sell four days a week and on the weekends she sells from her stall where the tourists visit.  She sells for cash or offers credit to her best customers and collects every week.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil based on what she needs.  She’s been doing this for three years and things are going well.  She started with the money from the first loan she got through the institution.

She will use the money from this loan to buy clothing, especially children’s uniforms and undergarments.  She’s been a part of the communal bank for three years and she enjoys it because it provides loans.

She hopes that her husband will get well and that he is able to return to his labors of the sea.  It’s difficult for her to pay all the expenses herself.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en: Robinah is a 34-year-old woman who is married with three children and lives in Kagadi, Uganda. She is a teacher by profession, a service she has provided for a period of 13 years. She would like to educate her children, buy a car and build a permanent home. Robinah wants a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina is 42 years old, and is married to Teofilo. She buys and sells pigs. Marcelina has been in this business for seven years and is successful in it. She started the business with two pigs and gradually expanded the business. She wants to receive a loan in the amount of 35,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy feed, vitamins and additional hogs to raise. She believes that this loan will help her to improve the business and is hoping that she will be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional hogs to raise.

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.en:
Emiliano is a father who has three school-age children. They live happily in a village planting and harvesting rice and vegetables for sale. He aims to continue sending his children to school to give them a better life. Despite the hardships in farming, he aims to expand his rice plantation to increase his production and income to satisfy his family's needs.

He is asking for an additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides needed for his rice farming business. He mentioned that his loan will enable him to improve his rice farming business and hopes that he will be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides needed for his rice farming business.

loans.name: Eshbay

texts.ru: Эшбай житель района Дж. Руми. Ему 54 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Эшбай занимается посевом ржа, моркови и арбуза. Этим видом деятельности он занимается десять лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Eshbay is a resident of the J. Rumy district.  He is 54 years old, married and has four children.  Eshbay is involved in sowing rye, carrots and watermelons.  He has been in this business for ten years.  He is requesting this loan to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: 03.4.75-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huyền works in agriculture raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and resell in the future.

Huyền is 26 years old and married with one child.

Huyền is the group leader of the 03.7.75.Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent.

In 2011, Huyền joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Huyền has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for three years. The main hardship that Huyền faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Huyền hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and resell .

loans.name: Nyamdorj

texts.en: Nyamdorj, 42 is a taxi driver and he runs his business around the districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He lives with his wife and his two children in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic yurt in a slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running his business for last two years non-stop. His wife used to have a grocery store before, but it is closed now. Lately, his business earnings have decreased notably due to a bad car. His car has been damaged and is getting old. It has been a negative influence on his family's income. Therefore, he and his wife decided to start the other business for their family's good. It will be a grocery store for the second time, because they both have good experience in this business field. Now he needs a loan to build inventories for his new grocery store.

loans.use: to build inventories for his new grocery store.

loans.name: Jenny Lorena

texts.es:
Jenny es una joven madre de 30 años, que cuida y vela por su pequeño de 5 años, al cual ama mucho y da lo mejor de sí diariamente con el fin de poder comprarle la ropa y alimentos que necesita para estar bien de salud. Jenny trabaja diariamente y en algunas ocasiones no pasa mucho tiempo con su pequeño, es por eso que disfruta de poder llevarlo al parque y pasear unas horas con él, para que de ese modo el sienta que Jenny siempre está pendiente de él.

Jenny disfruta mucho de la comida peruana y nos confiesa que uno de los platos que realmente le fascina es el “Arroz con pato y Carapulcra”. Con apoyo de sus padres, Jenny pudo lograr terminar el colegio, pero por contar con pocos ingresos ella no pudo estudiar la carrera universitaria que quiso “Derecho”, al encontrarse en esta situación, ella decidió nunca darse por vencida y es por ello que decidió poner su propio negocio de venta de hamburguesas y salchipollo, en el cual labora a partir de las 6 de la tarde hasta las 11 de la noche, principalmente dependiendo de la cantidad de personas que le compren diariamente. Ella piensa que su negocio tiene éxito porque ella siempre se esmera en la atención que brinda a sus clientes y trata de atenderlos lo más rápido posible con la finalidad de que se sientan felices del servicio que brinda.

Actualmente se le está brindando apoyo con el fin de que pueda comprar insumos (Papas, Tomates, Bolsas, Carnes, Embutidos, entre otros) para sus hamburguesas y salchipollo, lo que le permitirá ahorrar dinero al comprar en cantidad los productos que necesita. Ella está segura que de esta manera ella podrá mejorar sus ingresos, ya que ofrecerá mejores productos a sus clientes y así poco a poco comprará el kiosko que tanto desea, lo que la llevará a poner el pequeño restaurant que hará que sus ingresos crezcan y así construya su casa.
texts.en:
Jenny is a young mother, aged 30, who cares for and watches out for her young son, aged 5.  She loves him greatly and gives her all daily with the goal of being able to buy him the clothes and food he needs to be in good health.

Jenny works every day, and on some occasions she doesn't spend much time with her young son.  For this reason, she enjoys being able to take him to the park and being able to spend some time with him, as in this way he feels that Jenny is always focused on him.

Jenny very much enjoys Peruvian food, and tells us that one of the dishes that really fascinates her is "Rice with Turkey and Carapulcra" [Carapulcra is a traditional Peruvian dish].  With the support of her parents, Jenny has been able to complete high-school, but on account of her low income, she has not been able to study at university, where she would have studied Law.

To tackle this situation, she decided to never see herself as defeated, and for this reason she decided to start her own business selling hamburgers and "salchipollo" [french fries and chicken].  She works from 6 in the evening until 11 at night, depending primarily on the quantity of customers who buy from her each day.

She thinks that her business will be successful, because she always strives to give good service to her customers and tries to serve them as quickly as possible so they wind up happy with the service she provides.

Currently she is being provided support so that she can purchase supplies (potatoes, tomatoes, bags, meat, sausages, among other items) for her hamburgers and salchipollo.  This will allow her to save some money to purchase the products that she needs in bulk.  She is sure that in this way she will improve her income, and will be able to provide her customers with better products.  In this way she will be able to purchase the kiosk that she wants so much one step at a time, allowing her to set up a a small restaurant which will increase her income, and thus build her home.

loans.use: to purchase supplies (potatoes, tomatoes, bags, meat, sausages, and other things).

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda, 47, resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Romeo, her business partner, and is a mother to their children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Erlinda operates a computer rental shop. In the Philippines, very few people own their own computers. Thus, there is a need for them, especially for students who need to do their research and papers. She rents out computers by the hour and offers printing and typing services. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy new computer units, spare parts, and accessories needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Erlinda hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more inventory of vegetables for resale in her business.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is 46 years old and is a married woman with four children ages 9, 12, 13 and 19. Her husband works as a fisherman. Josefa is also involved in fishing. She sells her husband's catch at the market. She said that she also goes with her husband for fishing sometimes.

Josefa is requesting a loan to purchase fishing nets, floaters and lead weights. She hopes to have a stable income that would enable her to sustain her children's education. She also hopes to venture into another business to help augment their family income.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, floaters and lead weights.

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean de Dieu is married and has four children who all go to school. He has been a rice farmer for four years. He would like to get a loan to buy fertilizers and to support labor costs to get the best harvest in rice production. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to increase output, and to build a house if the profits are enough to do so.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and to support labor costs in rice production.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
This is Cristina, 42, a resident of Tondo, Manila, Philippines. Single, she manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Cristina operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition, but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Cristina’s regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 18,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Cristina hopes to grow her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tomato seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Saidu's Group

texts.en: These are teachers of a primary school based in Kenema city. This school was founded in 1992. Teachers of the school have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan. They requested a loan of 8,700,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for the entire group. With the help of this loan, these teachers are in a better position to buy or invest in something that their mere salaries cannot let them do. Saidu is the leader of the group. He is age thirty-five. He was born in Sumbuya, in Eastern Sierra Leone. He is married and has one child who is attending primary school. Saidu has been in the teaching profession for twelve years now. He has requested this loan in order to pay college fees for himself and school fees for his child.

loans.use: to pay college fees for himself and school fees for his child.

loans.name: Zikamo

texts.ru: Зикамо проживает в городе Вахдат. Ей 53 года. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Зикамо занимается скотоводством. Этим видом деятельности она занимается три года. Кредит берет для закупа коз и овец.
texts.en: Zikamo lives in the city of Vahdat.  She is 53 years old, married and has three children.  Zikamo is involved in animal husbandry.  She has been in this business for three years.  She is requesting this loan to buy goats and sheep.

loans.use: to buy small livestock

loans.name: Jessica Maria

texts.es: Jessica casada, tiene a sus hijos estudiando, su profesión es química industrial, tiene su propio negocio de alquileres de toldos, sillas, mesas y arreglos para celebraciones de ocasiones permitiéndole tener tiempo para atender a sus hijos.  Iniciándolo por la motivación de su compañero de vida ya que notaron que el aria donde habitan no hay ningún negocio de alquileres detectando la oportunidad para el negoció con fondo propios empezaron a comprar la mercadería. Se le ha presentado una dificultad que es de importancia resolver ya que la demanda es muy grande por lo cual necesita invertir en la compra de: picheles, bandejas, mesa, sillas, toldos, y además manteles.Tiene metas y planes tanto para su negocio como para el bienestar familiar. Considera importante apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que todavía están pagando su vivienda. Agradece la oportunidad de pertenece a la familia de créditos de la micro-financiera que realizara gran cambio en su vida plasmándose en la oportunidad de mercado que obtendrá.
texts.en:
Jessica is married, and her children go to school. She is an industrial chemist, and has her own business renting canopies, chairs, tables and decorations for event celebrations, allowing her to have time to care for her children. 

She started doing this with her life partner's encouragement, as they noticed that in the area where they lived there was no similar rental business. Perceiving an opportunity for the business, she started to buy merchandise with her own funds.

A difficulty has arisen, which is important for her to resolve. The demand is very great so she needs to invest in the purchase of pitchers, trays, tables, chairs, canopies, as well as tablecloths. 

She has goals and plans both for the business and for her family's well-being. She considers it important to support her husband with the household expenses as they are still paying for their house. 

She is grateful for the opportunity to be a part of the family of borrowers in the microfinance institution, which will work a great change in her life, in the form of the market opportunity she will have.

loans.use: To buy items for her business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is 54 years old and married with 3 children. She sells charcoal to earn a living and has been in the business for 12 years. She describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. To earn extra income she does farming. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her living standards and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 15,000 Kenya Shillings to buy charcoal for selling.

loans.use: To buy charcoal for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her candle making business.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is a 28-year-old gentleman who is married with two children and lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop for a period of six  years. He says inadequate capital is affecting the business. He would like to educate his children and expand his business to new markets. Wilson wants a loan to buy sugar, salt and baking powder for resale.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt and baking powder for resale.

loans.name: Ignace

texts.en:
Ignace is married with three children, who are between the ages of 9 months and 5 years old. Only one child goes to school; the two youngest are still too young to attend school. Ignace has been a rice farmer for 20 years. He would like to obtain a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to increase output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers, and to support labor costs for rice production.

loans.name: Venancio

texts.en: Venancio is a 27-year-old gentleman who is married and has one child living in Kagadi, Uganda. He deals in the entertainment business, specifically cinema shows, which he has run for a period of six years. He got capital from a clinic where he first worked as an attendant. He says inadequate capital is affecting the business. He would like to educate his child and expand his business to new markets. Venancio wants a loan to open up another video hall in another area.

loans.use: to open up another video hall in another area.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita, 52, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Saturnino, her business partner, and she is a mother to their children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nenita operates a computer rental shop. In the Philippines, very few people own their own computers. Thus there is a need for them, especially for students who need to do their research and papers. She rents out computers by the hour and offers printing and typing services. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 37,000 loan to buy new computer units, spare parts and accessories needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Nenita hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase additional computer parts and supplies

loans.name: Literato

texts.en:
Literato is 56 years old and is a married man with 4 children. His wife runs a sari-sari store business.

Literato is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. He has been growing and selling rice for 10 years. He earns about 6,000 PHP per month doing this farming. Literato plans to use his loan to purchase fertilizers and insecticides. He hopes to achieve an abundant harvest. He also hopes for his family's standard of living to improve.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is 36 years old, married, and the mother of a two year old. She has been in the livestock business for the last 18 years with a monthly income of about 18,000 KES. She is borrowing a first loan of 30,000 KES which she will use to purchase more livestock for resale. She anticipates using the proceeds to repay her loan as well as buy a water storage tank.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 27 years old, married to Julius, and blessed with three children, age 12, 8 and six years respectively. She has a grocery stall, a business she ventured into three years ago, and she earns a monthly income of about KES 6,000. 

She has requested a loan worth KES 30,000 to purchase fruits, vegetables, maize and beans for resale. The anticipated profit would contribute towards her buying a plot of land and building rental houses, which is also her dream. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase fruits, vegetables, maize and beans for sale.

loans.name: Daoud

texts.en: Daoud sells seedlings. He is from Gaza. He received his loan to buy a greenhouse.  Daoud is 28 years old and has been working in farming his whole adult life. His future plans are to improve the efficiency of his farm and increase his output.

loans.use: to buy a greenhouse

loans.name: Heberto Antonio

texts.es: Heberto de 37 años de edad es originario de León, realizo sus estudios hasta quinto grado de primaria, casado, de oficio comerciante, padre de 3 hijos los cuales están a su cargo. El se dedica a la actividad de la pesca desde hace 28 años  ya que le ayudaba a su mama desde muy joven luego se caso y decidió independizarse trabajando en la pesca por si mismo aunque nunca le dejo de ayudar a su familia, su expectativa es llegar a tener todas sus herramientas de trabajo. Realiza el crédito para la compra de redes de pescar, como planes futuros desea comprarse una lancha con su motor para más facilidades de trabajo.
texts.en: Heberto, 37 years old, is from León. He studied through the fifth grade of primary school. He is married, in business by trade, and father to 3 children who are in his care. He has been a fisherman for 28 years, since he helped his mother from the time he was very young. Then he married and decided to become independent, fishing for himself, although he never stopped helping his family. His hope is to come to have all of the tools for his work. He is taking out the loan to buy fishing nets. As a future plan, he wants to buy himself a motorboat in order to have more work opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 20 years old and single. He is in the business of selling firewood. He ventured into this business three years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 9,300. 

He has requested for a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase firewood for resale. The anticipated profit would help him open up cereal retail stores. His dream is to venture into different types of businesses. This is his first loan.

loans.use: to purchase firewood for resale.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred is a 35-year-old hardworking man with four children living in Kagadi, Uganda. He runs a business selling local brew and produce. He started as a hawker in different markets then saved and got capital for the current businesses. Price fluctuations and inadequate capital are factors affecting his operations. He would like to buy a car and educate his children, and for the business, he would like to expand it into new markets. Robert wants a loan to buy local brew and maize for resale.

loans.use: to buy local brew and maize for resale.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, all of whom are in school.  he also takes care of additional family members (elderly parents). Sarah has a business selling bananas. She has been in this business for ten years, and she works six days every week. Sarah sells her products from home, by means of retail. 

Sarah has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas for resale. She also generates additional income through a retail shop. The main business challenge(s) for Sarah include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and also to own a delivery van to ease transportation challenges. Sarah lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas for resale.

loans.name: Gerome

texts.en:
Gerome is married to a farmer. He has one child of five months. He has been a rice farmer for four years. He would like to obtain this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and to support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to increase output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009).
