María sueña con que en algún momento vaya a terminar su carrera y de esa manera dedicarse a la veterinaria que tanto le gusta y trabaja el doble ya que ella quiere que su niño también tenga esa carrera.
texts.en:
Señora Maria lives in the Maica Sud district, stop 9 1/5. She is 31 years old and studied only veterinary technology. She has a son who is 5 years old. She is a single mother. She is a dairy farmer. She has 16 dairy cows which have a daily production of 175 liters, which she delivers to another person in the district who makes soft cheeses.

Maria was not able to complete her studies since her stepfather died when she was at the university, and being the oldest, she had to leave school and work with her mother to be able to help her brothers and sisters finish school, since her mother also became sick, and so she began the milk-production work.

Maria is applying for the loan to purchase soy for her cattle because since she became a mother, she has her own house and her own cattle and thus her own income, with which she is raising her son, since his father abandoned him even before he was born. Maria dreams that at some time she can complete her studies and in this way become the veterinarian that she so much wants to be, and she will work twice as hard since she wants her son to also have this career.

loans.use: to buy feed for her cattle

loans.name: Sarantaniani - 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento SARANTANIANI – 26 esta  compuesto por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un varón, la presidenta del banco de emprendimiento es la Sra. Clotilde  tiene 40 años esta casada  tiene 3 hijos  de las edades de 22, 10 y 3, todos en edad escolar, todavía dependen de ella, la Sra. Clotilde se dedica  a la  venta de comida, esta es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Clotilde  utilizara  este préstamo para la compra insumos por mayor  para la elaboración de comida, como arroz, variedad de fideos y aceite y así de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo, la Sra. Clotilde enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y  utilizara los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida, la Sra. Clotilde es una persona muy trabajadora, se siente orgullosa y feliz por su trabajo y por el apoyo que le brinda la institución.
texts.en: The communal bank "SARANTANIANI – 26" is made up of eight members, seven women and one man. The president of the communal bank is Clotilde. She is 40 years old and married. She has 3 children, aged 22, 10 and 3. All are in school and still depend on her. Clotilde works selling food. This is her first loan cycle within the institution. Clotilde will use this loan to buy ingredients on a wholesale basis to prepare food, such as rice, a variety of noodles, and cooking oil. In this way she will increase her working capital. Clotilde faces challenges in her business such as the competition. She will use the benefits to improve her quality of life. Clotilde is a very hard-working person. She feels proud and happy about her work and the support provided to her by the institution.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food to sell.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 40 years old. She is from Nakuru and is married to Joseph; they have three children who are all in school. 

Anne has been a farmer for the past two years. She is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable her buy fertilizer and seeds, and to pay for labor. She is determined and hopes to have a good yield when harvesting time comes. 

She hopes to do large-scale farming in the future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds, and to pay for labour

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, and all her children are in school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She sells timber at the market. She sells her products on wholesale basis. She has been in business for the past eight years. She works six days a week. She has requested for a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more timber loads. Her major business challenges are thieves and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to build a house and also to expand her business. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, food and rent.

loans.use: to buy more timber loads for resale.

loans.name: Aliya

texts.ru: Алие 47 лет, вдова, живет совместно с сыном. В качестве  источника дохода для семьи, в 2010 году Алия начала   заниматься животноводством.  Начатое со стартовой суммы в 20,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц с продажи молока и молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Алия обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы Алия планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего  хозяйства.
texts.en: Aliya is 47 years old. She is a widow and lives with her son. As a source of income for her family, in 2010 Aliya began raising livestock. The business, which she started with an initial sum of 20,000 som (KGS), currently earns around 10,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and dairy products. In order to continue developing her business, Aliya has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional livestock. Aliya plans to invest her profits into further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
15 mujeres de la ciudad de Villa Elisa se unieron con la esperanza de trabajar juntas y con ese trabajo en conjunto poder ayudar a sus familias. Ellas son personas con un gran espíritu de superación, y lo demuestran gracias a su trabajo y a las reuniones que hacen semanalmente, lo que demuestra que tienen un gran interés en fortalecerse y salir adelante.
Sonia tiene una peluquería, y cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela, ya que ella es muy amable con todos sus clientes, y eso la ayuda a tenerlos siempre muy contentos con la atención que da. Gracias a su trabajo y dedicación ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia y a la vez aportar con los gastos que día a día surgen. Su sueño es poder tener un gran local y de esa forma también poder dar trabajo a las demás personas que necesitan.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de shampoo, enjuagues, spray, y demás productos, con los cuales podrá abastecerse y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando y tener bien surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
Fifteen women from the city of Villa Elisa came together with the hope of working together and helping their families thanks to this joint effort. They are people with a great desire to get ahead, and they demonstrate it in their work and in the meetings they hold each week, showing that they have a great interest in strengthening themselves and making progress. 

Sonia has a beauty salon, and she reports that she has a very good customer base, since she is very friendly with all her customers, and this helps always to keep them very happy with the service she provides. Thanks to her work and dedication, she has been able to get ahead and help her family, and at the same time contribute to covering the costs that come up day by day. Her dream is to have a large shop, which would allow her to provide work to other people who need it. 

She is requesting the loan to buy shampoos, rinses, sprays and other products, which will allow her to stock up, continue working and keep her business well supplied.

loans.use: to buy shampoos, rinses, sprays and other products.

loans.name: Yealie

texts.en:
This is 47-year-old Yealie. She is married and has three children aged 20, 15 and 9. She has four additional dependents, relatives of her husband, who live with her; some help at home and the others are in school. 

In 1985, Yealie established her rubber buckets, bowl, baskets, plates, etc. business. She began her business because she inherited it from her parents because she did not go to school. Working seven days a week and nine hours a day, she earns about 950,000 Leone (SLL) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 4,500,000 SLL. Yealie has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy 20 set Cole man (big) @ 70,000 SLL, 15 dozen big size plate bowls @ 120,000 SLL, 10 dozen set pans @ 120,000, and the balance will be used to transport the items. 

She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 700,000 SLL. In the future, Yealie plans to rent a big shop at the center of the town so that she can realize more profits to help her husband to educate their children to university level. She is honest and hardworking. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy Cole man (big), plates, bowls, pans, and to pay to transport the items.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 43 years old, from Nakuru, and is married with four children who are all in school.

Lucy has a business of selling vegetables and has been in this business for the past year. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD, to enable her buy more fruits and vegetables to add to her inventory for sale.

She hopes to establish a shop on her own piece of land in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more items like beans, simsim, cooking oil, and many others.

loans.name: Nkokoya

texts.en:
Nkokoya is 27 years old, married and blessed with two children. He is a livestock trader and has been running the business for the past ten years, making a monthly income of KES 30,000.

He has borrowed his first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD, with which he intends to purchase more livestock for resale. 

The anticipated profit will be reinvested to boost the business. His future dream is to improve his living standards and educate his children

loans.use: To buy more sheep for resale.

loans.name: Fudia

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Fudia. She is married and has one child, who is 14 years old. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her by adoption. In 2008, Fudia established her restaurant and bar business. She began her business just after she completed her diploma in food and brewing. Working six days a week and six hours a day, she earns about Le1, 200,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Fudia has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy 15 crates of Star beer at Le.56,000, 10 crates of Heineken beer at Le.120,000, 15 crates of Becks beer at Le.120, 000, and the balance will be used to renovate the restaurant and seating accommodations. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 960,000. In the future, Fudia plans to expand the restaurant. She is very hard working and accommodating. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy crates of beer and to renovate the restaurant and seating area.

loans.name: Uliya

texts.ru:
Юлие 45 лет. Юлия работает в пельменном цеху и в качестве дополнительного дохода, в  1990 году начала свой бизнес в  животноводстве со стартовой суммы 2,800 советских рублей. На сегодня,  в хозяйстве Юлии имеется  2 дойные коровы и 7 голов овец ,доходы от продажи молока и молочных продуктов составляют примерно 8,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Юлия обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп дополнительных голов скота. Доходы от кредита Юлия планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Uliya is 45 years old, she works in a factory that makes dumplings. As a source of additional income, in 1990 she launched her own livestock business with a starting sum of 2,800 Soviet roubles. Presently, Uliya's farm has 2 dairy cows and 7 sheep, while her monthly profits from sales of milk and dairy products amount to approximately 8,000 som (KGS). In order to continue developing her business, Uliya has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 130,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional livestock. She plans to invest her profits into further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with one child and her child is in school. She also takes care of additional family members. 

Harriet makes crafts. She sells her products on retail basis. She has been in this business for the past three months. She works seven days a week. She has requested for a loan of 100,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy raw materuilas for making crafts like baskets,mats and brushes. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. She also generates additional income through weaving. 

Her goals and aspirations are to own a big factory for making brushes. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and  food.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for making crafts like baskets, mats and brushes.

loans.name: Sinnah

texts.en: This is 34-year-old Sinnah. She is married, and has one child who is seven years old. In 1999, Sinnah established her textile and African dress business. She began her business after her employer folded up and returned to America due to the rebel war in Sierra Leone, therefore, she decided to utilized the benefit that was given to her to be in business. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about Le 1,300,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Sinnah requires a loan in order to buy 16 African dresses called Bamako, each of which costs Le 250,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 750,000. She is excited for the loan and she is planning to expand her business in the future and also hopes to see her only daughter educated to university level. Honest and hardworking, she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy African dresses called Bamako.

loans.name: Dhan Kumari

texts.en:
Dhan Kumari, 60, is married with one adult child, age 36. In 1995, she established her grocery store business and supports her family by working 10 hours a day, seven days a week. She has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy groceries for her business. Dhan Kumari thanks you for your support and, in the future, plans to improve her family’s economic condition. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, a small grocery store called a pasal is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily from these stores for cooking in the home. Owners of pasal stores, such as Dhan Kumari, use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and by purchasing in large amounts, the owners are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 square feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her business.

loans.name: Tural

texts.en: Tural is 26 years old and not married. He is engaged in a furniture making business. Tural has been working at the shop that he rented more than seven years ago and with two employees, he produces the furniture. He is trying to open his own furniture factory. In spite of being young, he is a very demanding and responsible man. He applied for 2,000 AZN, to buy materials to make furniture.

loans.use: to buy the materials to make furniture.

loans.name: Hani

texts.en: Hani recently opened his own cell phone store in Gaza. He hopes to get this loan in order to buy new phones for his store. He hopes that the new phones will attract more customers and improve his business and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy new phones for his store.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en: Josefa, 59, is from Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Phillipines. She is married and has three children. To make a living, she makes and sells snack foods to local members. She has been in business for 11 years and earns 2,500 PHP a month. In 2008, Josefa joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients to make products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to make products to sell.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard, aged 23, is from Olkalou and is not married. He is a farmer and has been for the past two years. He has applied for a loan from KADET LTD to buy fertilizers to use during the planting season.

He hopes to see his business expand and to be the leading farmer in his area.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Merle's Group

texts.en: Merle, 53, is widowed with two children and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Phillipines. Merle sells used "ukay-ukay" clothing and polvoron (powdered milk candy) to earn a living and has had this business for seven years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000.00 from her business. She has requested a loan for PHP 3,000.00 to purchase additional used clothing to sell. Merle became a member of PMPC this year. In the future, Merle hopes to build a stall for her business. Merle is the leader of a three-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member has his or her own business.

loans.use: to purchase additional used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more clothes to add to her stock.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, aged 29, is from Ndunyu and is married to Thomas. They have two children who are both in school.

Rose has an electronics business that she has been operating for the past three years. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy more electronics goods to add to her stock.

She hopes to open another electronics shop in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more electronics goods to add to her stock.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth, aged 50, is from Ndunyu and is married with five children who are all in school.

Beth has a grocery business that she has been operating for the past year. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy rice, beans and vegetables to sell.

She hopes to see her business expand and to be the leading businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina, aged 52, is from Nakuru and is married with three children who are in school.

Regina has a food stall business that she has been operating for the past three years. She has applied for her first loan to enable her to buy cooking ingredients to add to her stock.

She hopes to own a butcher's shop in the near future.

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients to add to her stock.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with seven children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of two additional family members (including her mother). Harriet has a beauty salon where she sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the past 15 years. She works seven days a week. 

Harriet has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy cream relaxers, treatments and braids. Her major business challenges are seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations are to own a fully stocked bridal salon and to educate her children up to university level. Harriet lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, food and rent.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, hair treatments and braids

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a single 24-year-old woman from Kilgoris who does not need to support anyone else at the moment.

Leah has operated a cereal-selling business for the last five years and makes a monthly income of KES. 7,300. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy two sacks of maize cereal. 


She will then use her profits to add to her stock of cereals. Her dream is to have a big cereal business.

loans.use: To buy corn cereal.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther, aged 46, is from Nakuru and is married with three children who are all in school. 

Esther has a business which sells earrings, bangles and cosmetics. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy earrings, bangles and cosmetics to add to her stock. 

She hopes to be able to open a cosmetics and boutique shop.

loans.use: To buy earrings, bangles and cosmetics.

loans.name: Baby Remie

texts.en:
Baby Remie, aged 41, is married and has three children aged 19, 16 and 10 years. She has three additional dependents who live with her after adoption from her brother and his wife. In 2008,  Baby Remie established her drinks and provisions business. She began her business because after leaving school she chose to set up a business as she could not further her education as she had no one to pay her fees. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, Baby Remie earns about Le 925,000 every month from her business. 

She would like to take out a loan of Le 5,000,000. Baby Remie has already received and successfully repaid one loan. She now requires a new loan in order to buy 10 crates of Guinness stout @ Le 90,000, 20 crates of star beer @ Le 48,000, 25 crates of soft drinks @ Le 26,000, 5 cartons of Carlsberg beer @ Le 105,000 and 10 cartons of peak milk @ Le 180,000 with the balance to be used for transport. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 850,000. In the future, Baby Remie plans to cater for more customers by expanding the shop.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy Guinness stout, star beer, soft drinks, Carlsberg beer and peak milk with the balance to be used for transport.

loans.name: Kanga

texts.en:
Kanga is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a vegetable stall, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing goods in her business. She dreams of establishing another business in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, potatoes and tomatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables, potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Ronald is 33 years old, from Kilgoris, and married to Jackline. They have two children aged eight and 10 years.

Ronald has operated a cereal-selling business for the last five years. He makes a monthly income of KES. 20,000. He is taking his second loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy more sacks of maize cereal to sell. 

He will use the profits to diversify into another business. His dream is to open other cereal outlets.

loans.use: To buy sacks of maize cereal.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbours. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more profits in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of clothes to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Damlie

texts.en: Damalie lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with seven children and all of her children are in school. She also takes care of two additional family members (aging parents). She sells Irish potatoes on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last three months. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 100,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more Irish potatoes. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rental house and her family does not have access to electricity nor piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, food and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of Irish potatoes

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, clothing and medical bills.

For the past six years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of increased prices in her business. Mlongo dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase cloth materials for her tailoring business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James, aged 25, is from Ndunyu and is married with two children. He is a farmer and has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy 10 sacks of potatoes and 10 sacks of peas to sell. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a client.

James hopes to become the leading farmer in his area and to see his business expand in the near future.

loans.use: To buy sacks of potatoes and peas to sell.

loans.name: Alhaji Lamin

texts.en:
Alhaji Lamin, aged 29, is married and has one child aged three years. In 2004, he established his provisions business. He began his business just after he completed his sixth form. He decided to go into business as a career and not to further his education as he saw it as a long-term investment and he needed the quickest way of earning money. Therefore, Alhaji Lamin decided to go into business with a small amount of income which he has expanded to this level. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from his business. 

Alhaji Lamin would like a loan of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy two cartons of peak milk @ Le 250,000, four cartons of luncheon meat @ Le 500,000 and two cartons of sardines @ Le 250,000. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 500,000. In the future, Alhaji Lamin plans to open an outlet for his wife. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy peak milk, luncheon meat and sardines.

loans.name: Mwenda

texts.en:
Mwenda is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing. 

For the past three years, Mwenda has operated a retail business, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of changes in prices at the market. She dreams of expanding her business to operate a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 25,000 loan, she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour and sugar to sell. Mwenda decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of two additional family members (her sisters). Victoria has a beauty salon where she sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the past 10 years. She works seven days a week. 

Victoria has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy boxes of cream relaxers, weaves and braids. Her major business challenges are the increasing price of cosmetics which affects her customer base and intermittent electricity. Her goals and aspirations are to own a fully stocked salon, to educate her children up to university level and also to build her own house. Victoria lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, food and rent.

loans.use: To  buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves and braids

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has run a grocery store in Nakuru town now for the past 20 years. She is 60 years old and married to Jasan: they have been blessed with two children.

This will be her first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the loan amount to increase her stock of grocery items like lemons, mangoes, carrots and watermelons as well as vegetables and thereby to serve her customers well.

In the future, Mary hopes to grow her grocery business and to earn more income hence improving her family's living standards.

loans.use: To increase her stock of grocery items like lemons, mangoes, carrots, watermelons and vegetables

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en:
Magdalene is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but does not have piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, shelter and medical bills.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of competition in her business. Magdalene dreams of expanding and becoming a wholesale supplier in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Afepeb Iv Group

texts.fr: Le groupement AFEPEB IV est composé de dix sept membres qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin . La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Juliette Marie, est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour la troisième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Juliette Marie est âgée de 64 ans et vit au Bénin. Juliette Marie est une veuve et mère de six enfants, mais aucun des enfants n'est plus à sa charge. Juliette Marie vit seule et assure seule ses différents besoins. Pour y parvenir, Juliette Marie mène comme activité depuis une dizaine d'année, la vente de tissus et de fournitures scolaires par le système de distribution. Juliette Marie achète ses produits au Bénin et au Togo. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Juliette Marie et les autres membres du groupement AFEPEB IV sollicitent un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en:
The AFEPEB IV group is comprised of 17 members who live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The representative of the group is Juliette Marie. She's the one with her hand raised in the photo. With the goal of boosting their business in order to better meet customer demand, this group is asking for ALIDE's financial support for the third time. 

Juliette Marie is 64 and lives in Benin. Juliette Marie is a widow and the mother of six children, none of which are dependent children. Juliette Marie lives on her own and takes care of her own needs. 

In order to do this, Juliette Marie has been selling fabric and school supplies for 10 years through the distribution network. Juliette Marie buys her products in Benin and Togo. 

With the goal of building up their business and better satisfying their customers, Juliette Marie and the other members of the AFEPEB IV group are asking for their 3rd loan with Alidé. Their goal is to grow their business.

loans.use: to buy fabric and school supplies.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is 24 years of age and single. He has operated a motorcycle transport business in Nakuru town now for the past seven months.
 
Alfred was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the existing clients who had also borrowed. This will be his first loan and he plans to use the loan amount to start a barber shop in town. This will enable him to earn more income as well as providing employment for other people.

Alfred is very determined and hardworking and hopes to own a motor vehicle for his transportation business and to also open more businesses in the future.

loans.use: To start a barber shop

loans.name: Natalina

texts.en:
Natalina is a 37-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has seven children between the ages of three and 15, all of whom go to school. 

Natalina has been running her mixed food business for eight years. She has no employees. Natalina heard about Finance Sudan through other clients and the outreach and promotion done by the loan officers. She is taking out a loan of 800 SDG to purchase more items like beans, simsim (sesame), cooking oil, tomato paste, dugar fish, etc. This business is Natalina's only source of income.

In five years' time, Natalina hopes for incremental growth in the size of her business and also to build her family tough grass-thatched houses.

Her major challenges include her low income rate and government plans.

Natalina says that she is happy with Finance Sudan’s support, not only the financial support but also the business training that has opened her mind to how to better run her business.

loans.use: to purchase items like beans, simsim (sesame), cooking oil, tomato paste. dugar fish, etc.

loans.name: Nanzugu

texts.en:
Nanzugu is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, shelter and medical bills.

For the past eight years, Nanzugu has operated a clothing selling business, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of competition in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a boutique shop in the future. 

With the the Kshs 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 44 years old and is married to James. They live in Ndunyu Njeru town and are blessed with four children. She has been a farmer now for the past 12 years.

Jane plans to use this loan amount to buy fertilizer as well as maize and potato seeds for planting on her farm during this planting season.

In the future, Jane hopes to invest more in her farming and to buy a plot and build commercial buildings and rental houses, hence earning more income and improving her family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and maize and potato seeds

loans.name: Raheli

texts.en:
Raheli is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, Raheli has operated a restaurant business; her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of competition from other restaurant operators in the area. Raheli dreams of establishing an outside catering business for weddings in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase food stocks of maize flour, wheat flour and sugar. Raheli decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase food stocks of maize flour, wheat flour and sugar.

loans.name: Ivania Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Ivania C. de 36 años de edad, comerciante, madre de dos hijos los cuales se encuentran en periodos de estudio. Su esposo tiene como oficio el ser pintor automotriz para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar.Agradece a Kiva ya que con el credito anterior pudo invertirlo en el inventario de su negocio. Ahora ella necesita el prestamo para realizar una re-inversion con la que comprara ropa nueva, zapatos y cosmeticos; misma que le servira de medio para que sus ganancias crezcan y a su vez el numero de sus clientes. Ivania le apasiona tanto el negocio que aprovecha las temporadas para vender los articulos que se venden por mayor en dichas etapas.Los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar sus condiciones de vida de manera que pueda siempre estarle invirtiendo a su negocio. Uno de sus poyectos en este 2012 es mejorar sus ingresos y ayudar a sus dos pequeños que tanto la necesitan.
texts.en:
Ivania C. is 36 years old. She is a merchant, and the mother of two children who are in school. Her husband is an auto painter by trade, in order to help her with the household costs.

She is grateful to Kiva, as with the earlier loan she was able to invest in her business's inventory. Now she needs the loan in order to re-invest, and buy new clothing, shoes and cosmetics. By this means her earnings will grow, and at the same time, the number of her customers.

Ivania has such a passion for the business, that she is taking advantage of the season to sell the items that are sold in bulk at this period.

Her plan for the future is to improve her living conditions, so that she can always be investing in her business. One of her projects for 2012 is to improve her income and help her two small ones who need her so much.

loans.use: To buy new clothing, shoes, and cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a 53-year-old man who is married with 6 children, all in school. He sells fish to the restaurants in his neighborhood and has been in the business for 6 years. 

Juma owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. He aspires to open a café in the future. He does farming as his side job, and he describes seasonality as a major challenge.

With the 10,000 KES loan he plans to add more stocks of fish to his business. He joined Yehu to get cheap loans.

loans.use: to add more stocks of fish to his business.

loans.name: Tamima

texts.en:
Tamima is a married woman with two children who are not yet enrolled in school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She has been operating a cafe for the last three years and aspires to open a hotel (a primitive restaurant) in the future. 

Tamima intends to use the 10,000 Kenyan shillings to open a kiosk. She describes market competition to be her challenge, and food to be her greatest monthly expense. She joined Yehu to access cheap funds.

loans.use: to open a kiosk.

loans.name: Dianne Diony

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando de venta de camaras digitales,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la aocia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el local donde vende camaras digitales.La socia solicita el credito para comprar camaras al por mayor.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues to sell digital cameras. She works from 8am to 6pm. Through her business, she is able to help her children move forward. Her dream is to expand the shop where she sells digital cameras.

The member is requesting a loan to buy cameras in bulk. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy cameras in bulk.

loans.name: Cesar Mateo

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes y gallinas,el socio los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende,por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño del socio es tmer un local donde pueda vender los animales.El socio solicita el credito para comprar cuyes y gallinas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
The member continues to make a living in the business of breeding animals like guinea pigs and chickens. The member raises, fattens and later sells them. Through this business the member is able to help his children get ahead. The member's dream is to have a place to sell the animals. He is requesting the loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

The member is happy for the loan and he commits to comply with the payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Abigael

texts.en:
Abigael is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past six years, she has operated a butcher shop business, selling to her community members. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase cow meat for sale at the butcher shop. She decided to join Yehu to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cow meat for sale at the butcher shop.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a restaurant business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of hiring more employees in the future.

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and rice for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and rice for sale.

loans.name: Auma

texts.en:
Auma is 36 years old. She is married with five children. She operates a grocery and second-hand clothes business. She has been operating this business for seven years with a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

This is her first loan from  KADET LTD. She plans to use the loan to buy stock of vegetables and second-hand clothes. She intends to use the anticipated profit from the business to educate her children and expand the business in the future.

loans.use: To buy stock of vegetables and second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Deffence

texts.en:
Deffence is a widow with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a grocery business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding and increasing stock in her business. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of bananas, onions and tomatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of bananas, onions and tomatoes.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 38 años que es divorciado y vive en el centro de "Latacunga" que es la capital de la provincia de "Cotopaxi", ubicada a una hora y media de la ciudad de Quito (que es la capital del Ecuador). Es una acogedora ciudad, que con su catedral y la Iglesia de San Francisco muestra la belleza del arte religioso, ambientadas con estrechas calles adoquinadas, resaltadas por los vivos colores de las típicas fachadas de sus viviendas y el polvoriento paisaje circundante. Latacunga viene de dos voces quichuas llacata kunka que significa Dios de las Lagunas. Cuando llega noviembre sus empedradas calles se llenan de alegría por la celebración de la fiesta en honor a la Virgen de las Mercedes, se trata de la ceremonia de la “Mama Negra” , que simboliza la fertilidad y la productividad de la tierra.

Hace un año, este emprendedor adquirió una franquicia dedicada a dar servicio de encomiendas en el cantón donde reside. Le ha ido muy bien durante este tiempo por lo cual ahora quiere invertir en la compra de una copiadora y de esta manera aprovechar la demanda de este servicio que existe en el sector. De esta manera Luis desea mejorar sus ingresos y con ello dar un mejor estilo de vida, que aunque no están junto a él, es su mayor preocupación.

A pesar de que su divorcio y con ello la separación de sus hijos han sido episodios muy duros, Luis tiene ganas de salir adelante y no quiere que sus hijos pasen por necesidades. Con esta inversión el quiere mejorar su negocio y esperamos que así sea.
texts.en:
Luis is a 38 year old man, he is divorced and he lives in the center of "Latacunga", which is the capital of the province of "Cotopaxi" located an hour and a half from the city of Quito [the capital of Ecuador]. It is a welcoming city, with its cathedral and the church of San Francisco displaying the beauty of religious art while livened with narrow, cobble stone streets. The streets are enhanced by the vibrant colors of the typical facades of the city's houses and the dusty surrounding landscape. Latacunga comes from two quichua words, "llacata" and "kunka", which mean God of the Lakes. When November comes the paved streets fill with joy with the celebration in honor of the festivity of the "Virgen de las Mercedes". It is the ceremony of the "Black Mother" which symbolizes the fertility and the productivity of the land.

A year ago, this entrepreneur acquired a franchise that offers the delivery of packages in the canton in which he resides. He has done very well in this time which is why he now wants to invest in the purchase of a copy machine and thus take advantage of the demand that exists in the sector for this service. In this way, Luis hopes to better his income and provide a better quality of life, even though they are not with him, it is his biggest worry. In spite of his divorce and the separation from his children having been hard times, Luis wants to get ahead and he doesn't want for his children to go through any necessities. With this investment he wants to improve his business and we hope it happens this way.

loans.use: to buy a copy machine for his business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with 6 children, all enrolled in school. She operates both a kiosk and a greengrocer's shop, and has been running these businesses for 10 and 5 years respectively. Fatuma owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her goal is to open a boutique in the future.

She plans to use the loan of 20,000 KES to add stock of maize flour and sugar to her kiosk. Her monthly expenditures are mostly on food and school fees. She joined Yehu to access loans.

loans.use: to add stock of maize flour and sugar to her kiosk.

loans.name: Herima

texts.en:
Herima is a married woman with six children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a fruit-selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase passion fruit, pawpaw and oranges. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase passion fruit, pawpaw and oranges.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and water bills.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She dreams of expanding to become a wholesale supplier of clothes in the future.

With a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is a married man with four children, three of whom are enrolled in school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. For the last ten years, he has been engaged in the water selling business. He also operates a café as his side job. Seasonality is his major challenge. Food and school fees are his greatest monthly expenses.

With a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings, he plans to open a new café and desires to open a hotel in the future. He joined Yehu due to their good products.

loans.use: to open a new café.

loans.name: Magdalena María

texts.es:
En el balneario de San Clemente del Cantón Sucre  cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal 1 de Diciembre. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros,  ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

En este lugar vive la señora Magdalena. Tiene 64 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun viven con ella. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que se dedica tanto al hogar como también al comercio, en su casa se dedica a la venta de carne, pollos, camarón y otros mariscos por libras, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h0 hasta las 16h00, nos cuenta que hay temporadas muy buenas en la que llegan muchos turistas y sus ventas aumentan mucho, ella siempre compra lo mejor para que sus clientes lleven un buen producto y esto le garantiza nuevas ventas, ella  lleva más de 15 años en este  negocio y  le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar carne, pollos, camarón, entre otras cosas que vende en su local. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella empezó su negocio.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Every 15 days in the seaside resort of San Clemente del Cantón Sucre, the 1st of December Communal Bank meets. This place is known for its beautiful beaches that are much visited by domestic and foreign tourists. It offers a diversity of beautiful locations and a rich variety of typical dishes of the region.
In this place lives Magdalena. She is 64 years old, married and in this relationship has three children who are already grown up, one of whom still lives with her. Her husband is a fisherman.
She is a very hardworking woman that works in the home as well as in her business.  From her home she sells meat, chicken, shrimp and other seafood by the pound. She works everyday from 8am to 4pm. She tells us that there are very good periods in which lots of tourists arrive and her sales go up a lot. She always buys the best so that her clients take away a good product, and this guarantees her new sales. She has been in this business for 15 years, and it is going really well.
She will use this loan to buy meat, chicken and shrimp among other things that she sells in her shop. She is a founding member of the communal bank, and she likes it because thanks to the loans, she started her business.
Her goals are to continue getting ahead in her business.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, shrimps etc.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a widow with five children, all of whom go to school. She has been a rice farmer for twelve years. She would like to get a Kiva loan to buy seeds and support the labor costs of rice production, in order to get the best harvest. With the profits, she plans to expand the area she has been farming to get a greater output.
 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition, because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and support the labor costs of rice production.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a doughnut selling business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase wheat flour and maize flour to make doughnuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour and maize flour to make doughnuts.

loans.name: Holliness

texts.en:
Holliness is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a divorced woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a food stall business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bags of wheat flour, sugar and beans for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of wheat flour, sugar and beans for resale.

loans.name: Venantie

texts.en:
Venantie is single. She has been a rice farmer for twelve years. She would like to get a Kiva loan to buy seeds and pesticides, and to support the labor costs of rice production, in order to get the best harvest. With the profits, she plans to expand the area she has been farming to get a greater output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more seeds and pesticides, and to support labor costs.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is the mother of two children, neither one attending school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She has been operating a shop for the last three years, and her primary customers are her neighbors. She describes her challenge as the high cost of transportation and her greatest monthly expense as food.

With a loan of 45,000 KES, she plans to add stock of maize flour, sugar and cooking oil. Stella joined Yehu to access loans. She desires to start a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: to add stock of maize flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman with five children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years she has operated a vegetable stall, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With a loan of 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of vegetables, tomatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of vegetables, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Cyriaque

texts.en:
Cyriaque is married. He has two children. He has been a rice farmer for 10 years. He would like to get this loan to buy seeds and support labor costs to get the best harvest of rice production. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more seeds and support labor costs.

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is married. He has three children. Two of them go to school. 

He has been a rice farmer for two years. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy seeds and support labor costs to get the best harvest in the production of rice. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more ou put.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more seeds and support labor costs for the rice production

Cyprien is single. He has been a rice farmer for three years. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy seeds, pesticides and support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To cover labor costs during rice production and buy seeds and pesticides.

Daniel is married with two children. They both go to school. He has been a rice farmer for 9 years. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy seeds, pesticides and support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs for his rice production

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean De Dieu is single. He has spent five years as a rice farmer. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy seeds, pesticides and support labor to get the best harvest in the rice production. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay labor to help him on the rice farm.

Prudencienne is married. She has three children. They all go to school. She has been a rice farmer for 15 years. She would like to get this loan to buy seeds, pesticides and support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, she plans to expand the area she has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). loans.use: to buy more seeds, pesticides and support labor costs in her rice production.

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois is married. He has been a rice farmer for the period of 20 years. He would like to get this loan to buy seeds, pesticides and support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). loans.use: to buy more seeds, pesticides and support labor costs in the rice production.

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en:
Alphonse is married. He has six children. They all go to school. 

He has been a rice farmer for 35 years. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy seeds and support labor costs to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). loans.use: To buy more seeds and support labor costs in growing rice.

loans.name: Jean D Amour

texts.en:
Jean D Amour is married. He three children between 15 and 21 years old. They all go to school. 

He has been a rice farmer for 30 years. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy seeds and support labor cost to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more out put.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations.
